title: Barber/Stylist

description:

HAMMER & NAILS WHIPPANY, a Grooming Club for Guys is HIRING!!

title: Loss Control Consultant
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW**

Sedgwick’s contractor team conducts on-site inspections to assess properties and provide comprehensive reports to our clients for underwriting purposes. Sedgwick provides high-quality, detailed assessments, helping clients make informed decisions about their policies.

**ROLE TYPE**: 1099 (Independent Contractor)

**COMPENSATION:**

Compensation for this position is predominately a per-inspection flat rate within a specified travel radius.

**CRITICAL SKILLS**

* Deep understanding of commercial and residential property and casualty lines, including property, general liability, auto, and risk management/Workers’ Compensation. \\*
* Strong written and verbal communication skills to produce clear and concise reporting.
* Keen observational and analytical skills to effectively evaluate risks.
* Organizational and time management skills to ensure deadlines are met.

**DUTIES**

* Evaluate and document potential risks and hazards in various properties by conducting loss control inspections for insurance companies.
* Prepare comprehensive reports detailing findings, observations, and recommendations for underwriting purposes.
* Upload completed reports, photos, and diagrams utilizing platforms or web-based systems.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Minimum of 3 years of proven experience providing loss control services. HS diploma or equivalent.
* Proficient with PC and internet, including Microsoft Office Suite.
* Professional conduct and excellent interpersonal skills, along with strong analytical, consultative, and interpretive skills.
* Must be physically able to complete inspections to adequately assess properties and be comfortable working outside in various weather conditions and temperatures.
* No active licensed insurance agents/producers due to potential conflict of interest.

\\* Some high-level assignments will require understanding of Workers’ Compensation for which credentials and qualifications will be required (some States require State approval to conduct WC surveys).

**NOTE: Criminal and motor vehicle record check, confirmed via a background screening, is required for this position.**

*The statements contained in this document are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by a contractor assigned to this description. They are not intended to constitute a comprehensive list of functions, duties, or local variances. Management retains the discretion to add or to change the duties of the position at any time.*

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $3.00 - $150.00 per day

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Commercial loss control inspection: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: On the road
company_description: Sedgwick is a leading global provider of technology-enabled risk, benefits and integrated business solutions.

title: Amazon Prime Delivery Associate
description:
EY Parker Logistics LLC is a family logistics company in partnership with Amazon. We offer competitive compensation, daily bonuses, monthly bonuses, a great company culture, and opportunities for growth. No delivery experience required.

Shifts: **You will be required to work one weekend day. Approximate hours are 10:30am- 9pm**

Location: **Syosset, Long Island**.

What You’ll Do:

As a Delivery Associate, you can expect to work 4 days per week/10 hrs a day. *Please be prepared to provide a copy of your Abstract Drivers Record.*

Why You’ll Love Working as a Delivery Associate:

* **Earn more:** competitive compensation (monthly bonuses, peak bonuses, employee discounts to restaurants, stores, vacations, etc)
* **Compelling Benefits:** paid time off and health insurance for all full-time employees
* **Independence:** spend the majority of your day on the road delivering smiles to customers
* **Stay active:** you’ll be on the move during your shift as you deliver packages from the delivery vehicle to the customer’s doorstep
* **Professional growth:** we offer career growth opportunities such as moving into Lead Driver, Dispatcher, or Team Leader. Promotions come from within.
* **Team environment:** a fun, fast-paced, and supportive company culture

What You’ll Need:

* Must be at least 21 years old
* Must have a valid driver's license within the state of employment
* Must be able to move boxes up to 50 lbs., with or without reasonable accommodation
* Must have a positive attitude

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $21.25 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

Work Days:

* Every weekend
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: On the road

title: Real Estate Acquisitions Manager
description:
**Sales Agent** - Property Acquisition Specialist

Are you **Great at Sales**??

Does this Describe You??

* You enjoy negotiating, and want an **uncapped income** opportunity
* You **connect well w/people,** and can close confidently
* You like **helping people, winning** at what you do **and making money**
* You're looking for **the right opportunity** to apply your drive and skills

If this Sounds Like You...

Then **Read On, Apply** and **take our Job Fit Assessment** at the link down below Now!

We are looking for someone who **Excels At Sales** to join our real estate company and help us Acquire Investment Properties in and around Indianapolis.

**We Offer:**

* Leads for you to work with and pay for all of the marketing
* High-end sales training along with a cell phone and business cards
* Advanced software tools to help manage clients and activities
* Inside Sales support to help warm up & follow up w/your prospects
* A commission-based comp plan with NO cap on earnings

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage and nurture a database of seller leads
* Quickly qualify opportunities and gauge motivation
* Effectively build rapport and gain trust w/sellers
* Visit homes when necessary to assess the condition & take photos
* Analyze opportunities and market data to determine pricing
* Overcome objections and successfully negotiate purchase contracts
* Track sales activities and lead notes in software database

**Qualifications:**

* MUST take a Job Fit Assessment to be interviewed (link is down below)
* FULL-TIME Commitment
* Exceptional phone skills and strong communication abilities
* Strong attention to detail and ability to effectively nurture leads over time
* Able to quickly process details, and create win/win solutions
* Some light construction knowledge is preferred
* Real estate experience is a major plus

**Job Fit Assessment:**

If you are applying for this job, please take this assessment as soon as possible. Allow roughly 45 minutes of undistracted time to complete this assessment:

https://teamarchitects.asmt.io/XCRX4NKCR/AcquisitionsAgentPro-Assessment-VisionaryVentures

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $95,536.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Centereach, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Veterinary Technician – Emergent Care, Overnight
description:
**GSVS VETERINARY EMERGENCY SERVICES TOMS RIVER** is excited to announce we are hiring **Veterinary Technicians (CVT or Experienced)** **Overnight** for our brand-new Emergent clinic!  

  

**Sign on Bonus for full time technicians!!**  

  

**Hours:** Tuesday and Wednesday, 7pm -8am or Sunday - Wednesday, 7PM - 8AM or Thursday - Saturday, 8:30PM - 8AM  

  

Shining a spotlight on our amazing veterinary technician: Veritas Role Spotlight: Veterinary Technician Specialist (youtube.com)  

  

**Veterinary Technicians** and **Veterinary Assistants** are on the front lines of nursing care, providing appropriate medical care and treatments as ordered by the veterinarian. On any given day, you will:* Triage patients as needed
* Run laboratory tests
* Calculate medical math
* Place IV catheters and institute fluid therapy
* Maintain accurate treatment sheets and anesthesia records
* Obtain and prepare various blood samples for diagnostic testing
* Assess pain scale of patients and support as needed
* Act as patient’s advocate and provide quality, compassionate care for hospitalized patients
* Provide client education on a wide range of at home care
* Administer and monitor anesthesia
* Administer medications
* Assist in patient care
* Help keep hospital clean and stocked
* Assist with phone calls and checking in clients

  

**About you:*** Veterinary Technician, CVT/LVT preferred or a minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Veterinary Technician and proficient with anesthetic monitoring
* Proficiency in processing basic laboratory specimens
* Working knowledge of anatomy and physiology
* Understanding of normal vs abnormal physiologic ranges
* Commitment to help mentor and train veterinary assistants
* Ability to work well and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Compassionate, positive outlook and friendly, team-orientated attitude
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* The ability to deliver exceptional client service
* Honesty, integrity, and a desire to learn and have fun!

  

**Schedule (Veterinary Technician):*** Tuesday and Wednesday, 7pm -8am or Sunday - Wednesday, 7PM - 8AM or Thursday - Saturday, 8:30PM - 8AM

  

**GSVS is proud to offer the following benefits:*** Competitive salary based on your level of experience
* Health, dental, and vision insurance, some plans paid 100%
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Retirement Plan – 401K with employer match
* Licensing fees paid for credentialed technicians
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Paid Time off
* Mental health support with Talkspace
* Uniforms provided
* Pet discounts for medical care

  

**GSVS VETERINARY EMERGENCY SERVICES TOMS RIVER** is *located at 1882 Hooper Ave, Toms River, NJ 08753.*  

  

#VETTECH #VETASST*Veritas Veterinary Partners is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the requirements of all applicable federal, state and local laws, we welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status.*

*All current positions require the ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently. Additional fluency in other languages is preferred but not required.*

title: Veterinary Technician - Emergency
description:
**Garden State Veterinary Services** is excited to announce we are hiring for Veterinary Technicians to join our Specialty/Emergency practice in Woodbridge, NJ. We have immediate openings for full and part time candidates!

  

Shining a spotlight on our amazing veterinary technician: Veritas Role Spotlight: Veterinary Technician Specialist (youtube.com)  

  

**About GSVServices:** We are a multispecialty practice with boarded specialists in cardiology, internal medicine, surgery, radiology, and critical care. Our clients and patients also have access to ophthalmology, oncology, radiation oncology, neurology, dermatology, and radioactive iodine treatment.

**Why GSVServices:** We are not your typical veterinary hospital! We know the winning recipe to maintain the care and compassion that our patients depend upon us for, is to create a safe and supportive space for you to put your skills to use, develop new skills, and be a part of our highly collaborative, fun, and friendly team! We are proud of our company culture and positive staff engagement within a fast paced, learning environment; and our associate employment longevity is proof of our commitment to take care of one another, and provide the highest standard of care to the patients we serve.

**Veterinary Technicians** at GSVServices work along specialists and have access to the most advanced diagnostic tools to provide the best possible care. On any given day, you can expect to do the following:

* Assist with general anesthesia and sedated procedures
* Set up CRIs and calculate medical math
* Place IV catheters and institute fluid therapy
* Position appropriately for radiographs and understand radiation safety
* Provide quality, compassionate care for hospitalized patients
* Prepare and administer transfusions: Blood and Plasma
* Maintain accurate treatment sheets and anesthesia records
* Understand capnography, pulse oximetry, ECG and blood pressure monitoring
* Obtain and prepare various blood samples for diagnostic testing
* Provide client education on a wide range of at home care

**Schedule:**

* Swing availability, 1 weekend day required

**About you:**

* CVT/LVT/RVT preferred, or a minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Technician
* Comprehensive understanding of and experience with anesthetic monitoring
* Proficiency in processing basic laboratory specimens
* Working knowledge of anatomy and physiology
* Understanding of normal vs abnormal physiologic ranges
* Commitment to help mentor and train veterinary assistants
* Ability to work well in a highly collaborative environment
* Commitment to develop long-term relationships with colleagues, clients, and community
* Positive outlook and friendly, team-orientated attitude
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* The ability to deliver exceptional client service
* Honesty, integrity, and a desire to learn and have fun!

**GSVServices is proud to offer the following benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on your level of experience
* Health, dental, and vision insurance, some plans paid 100%
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Retirement Plan – 401K with employer match
* Licensing fees paid for credentialed technicians
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Paid Time off
* Mental health support with Talkspace
* Uniforms provided
* Full Time and credentialed technicians eligible for Sign On Bonus
* Pet discounts for medical care


Garden State Veterinary Services is located at 1200 Route 9, Woodbridge NJ 07095

title: Veterinary Technician - Neurology
description:
**Garden State Veterinary Services** in Woodbridge is excited to announce we are hiring CVTs, or experienced technicians, who will rotate through other hospital services, for our Neurology Department! We are happy to guide, mentor, train and support the right candidate but anesthesia experience is required!  

  

  

Shining a spotlight on our amazing veterinary technician: Veritas Role Spotlight: Veterinary Technician Specialist (youtube.com)  

  

**About GSVServices:** We are a multispecialty practice with boarded specialists in cardiology, internal medicine, surgery, radiology, and critical care.  

  

**Why GSVServices:** We are not your typical veterinary hospital! We know the winning recipe to maintain the care and compassion that our patients depend upon us for, is to create a safe and supportive space for you to put your skills to use, develop new skills, and be a part of our highly collaborative, fun, and friendly team! We are proud of our company culture and positive staff engagement within a fast paced, learning environment; and our associate employment longevity is proof of our commitment to take care of one another, and provide the highest standard of care to the patients we serve.  

  

**Veterinary Technicians** in the neurology department at GSVS will work side by side with our neurologist as you help manage a variety of neurologic conditions including seizures, vestibular disease, and intervertebral disc disease. On any given day, you can expect to assist with:* Perform general anesthesia for CT, MRI, spinal taps, and neurosurgery
* Understand and address abnormalities with capnography, pulse oximetry, ECG and blood pressure monitoring
* Calculate drug dosages, draw up medications, administer medications, and run CRIs
* Place IV catheters and institute fluid therapy
* Position appropriately for MRI and spinal taps
* Obtain and prepare various blood samples for diagnostic testing
* Restrain appropriately for a neurologic examination
* Provide client education on a wide range of at home care

  

**About you:*** CVT/LVT preferred or a minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Technician
* Comprehensive understanding of and experience with anesthetic monitoring
* Proficiency in processing basic laboratory specimens

* Commitment to help mentor and train veterinary assistants

* Commitment to develop long-term relationships with colleagues, clients, and community
* Positive outlook and friendly, team-orientated attitude
* Excellent communication and organizational skills

title: Veterinary Hospital Manager
description:
We are looking for **YOU** to join our new **Emergent Care** facility – GSVS Veterinary Emergency Services Morristown – in Morristown, New Jersey as a Veterinary Hospital Manager!  

  

We are a team-oriented, skilled practice where our Veterinary Hospital Manager will play a pivotal role! You will contribute to enhancing a dynamic culture founded on collaborative communication and optimal patient care. You will have the support and guidance of the GSVS leadership team. With their support and your expertise, you will complete all standard Veterinary Technician duties in addition to management duties such as:  

  

**What will you do in this role?*** Provide appropriate medical care and treatments as ordered by the veterinarian.
* Collaborate seamlessly with everyone in the hospital, providing help where help is needed despite formality of role definition.
* Monitor and maintain the office, in addition to clinical and medical supplies.
* Oversee all services to the hospital, including (but not limited to): medical gas and waste removal, pet cremation and remains services, etc.
* Hire, train, manage, and schedule veterinary technicians and assistants.
* Monitor and resolve conflicts between team members in real time so that patients receive the appropriate care.
* Serve as role model, mentor, and coach for Technicians and Assistants anywhere in the hospital.
* Work with GSVS Referral Coordinator to own local referring DVM relationships.
* Lead communications around escalated Customer Service concerns as they arise.

  

**About you:**  

* Licensed Veterinary Technician preferred but will consider those with at least 5 years of clinical experience.
* Experience in a supervisory or leadership role.
* A seasoned professional able to focus others on the most important clinical activities at the moment.
* An effective communicator, both verbally and in writing.
* An empathetic listener.
* An adaptive learner and effective teacher of others.

  

**Schedule:*** Urgent Care practice open 7 days/week, 1PM- 10PM
* Shift hours are from 12:30pm – 10:30pm

  

**Benefits and Compensation:*** Salary is highly competitive
* Sign-on bonus and relocation allowance
* Health, dental, and vision options, some plans paid 100%
* Parental leave
* 401K with company match
* Company equity
* Life insurance
* Generous CE and PTO
* Reimbursement of all licensure fees
* Mental health support with Talk space

  

GSVS Veterinary Emergency Services Morristown is located at *191 E Hanover Ave, Morristown, NJ 07960.*

In accordance with the requirements of all applicable federal, state and local laws, we welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status.*

title: Veterinary Technician - ICU Overnight
description:
**Garden State Veterinary Services** in Woodbridge, NJ is excited to announce we are looking for experienced veterinary technicians to work overnights in our ICU department!  

  

Shining a spotlight on our amazing veterinary technician: Veritas Role Spotlight: Veterinary Technician Specialist (youtube.com)  

  

**About GSVServices:** We are a multispecialty practice with boarded specialists in cardiology, internal medicine, surgery, radiology, and critical care. Our clients and patients also have access to ophthalmology, oncology, radiation oncology, dermatology, and radioactive iodine treatment.

**Why GSVServices:** We are not your typical veterinary hospital! We know the winning recipe to maintain the care and compassion that our patients depend upon us for, is to create a safe and supportive space for you to put your skills to use, develop new skills, and be a part of our highly collaborative, fun, and friendly team! We are proud of our company culture and positive staff engagement within a fast paced, learning environment; and our associate employment longevity is proof of our commitment to take care of one another, and provide the highest standard of care to the patients we serve.

**ICU Technician responsibilities:**

* Record medical data thoroughly and accurately and complete treatments in a timely manner
* Uphold ICU policies and protocols and perform all other related duties as required
* Partake in cardiopulmonary resuscitation and stabilization of critical patients
* Maintain a clean, dry and comfortable environment for all patients at all times
* Continuous and diligent monitoring of critical and intensive care patients
* Manage sedation and anesthesia in a variety of critical patient settings
* Placement and maintenance of central, peripheral intravenous, and arterial lines
* Placement and maintenance of urinary catheters and nasogastric and nasoesophageal tubes
* Management of thoracostomy, tracheostomy and other indwelling tubes
* Administration of blood component therapy, and all aspects of fluid therapy
* Calculation and monitoring of continuous rate infusions
* Care of the mechanically ventilated patient where needed

**About you:**

* Certified technician: minimum of 2 years in an ICU setting or 5+ years as a technician
* Team oriented
* Motivated self-starter
* Detail oriented
* Sound problem solving abilities
* Ability to communicate with clients and all members of the veterinary team
* Empathetic and kind approach to patient care
* Positive outlook

* Honesty, integrity, and a desire to have fun!

title: Spanish Instructor for kids grades pre-k (NYC)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $75 per class. It's about a 1 hour 20 minute commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contactor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occassionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for Spanish Immersion**

Designed for young students, Spanish Immersion teaches conversational and basic Spanish language using Total Physical Response (TPR)- a "learn by doing" approach. Every activity has students speaking, listening, acting and learning, and is enriched by studies of Spanish and Latin American cultures!

This class comes with curriculum.

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $50 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

**Dates for the class:** 9/26/24 - 12/12/24

**Times:** 2:45pm- 3:25pm

**Grades:** prek-k

**Neighborhood:** Upper East Side (E. 70's)

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, guitar, chess, programmable robots, yoga, LEGO, Sportsworld, ninja academy and dinoworld.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Regional Director - East
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

**Working at Abbott**


At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

* Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of .
* Free medical coverage for employees\\* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO
* An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution
* Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
* A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
* A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.


Leading an active lifestyle is important to the many people we serve. In Abbott’s Heart Failure division, we’re advancing the treatment of heart and vascular disease through breakthrough medical technologies in electrophysiology and heart failure, allowing people to restore their health and get on with their lives.


This position covers our East region (New York, Charlotte, Atlanta) in the Abbott Heart Failure, Acelis Connected Health business. Our Heart Failure solutions are helping address some of the World’s greatest healthcare challenges.

**MAIN PURPOSE OF ROLE**


Ensures that the assigned region meets or exceeds sales and profitability objectives. Formulates sales strategies for markets within the assigned geography and product lines in order to attain revenue goals set by the company. Works with sales representatives to identify and evaluate market opportunities and sales potential and to establish and achieve their annual sales objectives. Manages and coaches the activities of sales representatives, clinical representatives, and other field personnel. Negotiates contracts with external customers. Keeps the company informed of market dynamics and competitive activity. Responsible for the management and implementation of company policies. Travel required 50-75%.

**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Recruits, coaches and develops organizational talent.
* Fosters a diverse workplace that enables all participants to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational objectives.
* Creates an entrepreneurial environment.
* Provides direction and guidance to exempt specialists and/or supervisory staff who exercise significant latitude and independence in their assignments. May supervise non-exempt employees.
* Keeps the organization's vision and values at the forefront of decision making and action.
* Demonstrates effective change leadership.
* Builds strategic partnerships to further departmental and organizational objectives.
* Develops and executes organizational and operational policies that affect one or more groups by utilizing technical/professional knowledge and skills.
* Monitors compliance with company policies and procedures (e.g. compliance with FDA, BSI, EEO regulations, etc.).
* Makes decisions regarding work processes or operational plans and schedules in order to achieve department objectives.
* Develops, monitors and appropriately adjusts the annual budget for department(s).

**QUALIFICATIONS**

**Education**

* Bachelors Degree (± 16 years) or an equivalent combination of education and work experience
* Masters Degree (± 18 years), Preferred

 **Experience/Background**

* Minimum 5 years sale management experience
* Prior experience, knowledge of medical devices preferred.
* Provides direction and monitors progress of exempt specialists and/or supervisory staff toward departmental goals; monitors costs of projects and of human and material resources within a department or unit; monitors company-wide indicators such as market share and profitability; monitors external environment in area of technical or professional responsibility.
* Will perform this job in a quality system environment. Failure to adequately perform tasks can result in noncompliance with governmental regulations.

**Apply Now**

* Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.

 **Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives:** www.abbottbenefits.com  

  

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity

  

The base pay for this position is $119,500.00 – $220,400.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Textile Designer
description:
**Position Overview:** We are seeking a talented and innovative Textile Designer to join our creative team at Sutton Home Fashions. The Textile Designer will be responsible for conceptualizing and creating unique textile patterns, prints, and fabric designs that align with our brand vision and market trends. This role involves working closely with product development, marketing, and production teams to bring textile concepts from initial sketches to finished products.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop original textile patterns, prints, and cohesive collections that align with brand identity and seasonal trends.
* Collaborate with product development and marketing teams to understand design requirements, target audience, and project goals.
* Conduct research on current trends, market needs, and competitor designs to inform and inspire design concepts.
* Create and present design concepts, including mood boards, color palettes, and fabric samples, to stakeholders and clients for review and feedback.
* Utilize textile design software and tools (e.g., Adobe Illustrator, CAD software) to produce detailed design specifications and fabric prints.
* Work closely with production teams to ensure designs are accurately translated into finished textiles, addressing any technical or production challenges.
* Maintain organized files and records of design assets, including digital files, sketches, and samples.
* Stay updated on industry advancements, new materials, and design techniques to continually innovate and improve textile designs.
* Assist with other design-related tasks and projects as needed to support the team’s overall objectives.
* Create cohesive and innovative design collections that align with brand identity and seasonal trends.

**Requirements:**

* **Minimum 5 years** of textile design work experience in home textile industry
* Proven experience as a Textile Designer or in a similar role within the textile, fashion, or related industry.
* Strong portfolio showcasing a range of textile designs, prints, and fabric patterns.
* Proficiency in textile design software and tools, particularly Adobe Illustrator and CAD software.
* Solid understanding of textile production processes, fabric properties, and print techniques.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate concepts into practical and aesthetically pleasing textile designs. Self-motivated, showing initiative and follows through.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team and across departments.
* Strong time management skills and an ability to prioritize work and juggle multiple tasks.
* Travel to sales meetings, line reviews, and markets as needed
* Bachelor’s degree in Textile Design, Fashion Design, or a related field; additional certifications or coursework in textile design is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Textile Design work: 5 years (Required)

title: Strategic Relationships Associate, Community Engagement
description:
**Mayor's Office for International Affairs**

**Position Title: Strategic Relationships Associate, Community Engagement**

**Job ID: 43738**  



**The Agency You’ll Join:**  

The New York City Mayor’s Office is responsible for overseeing city services throughout the five
  

boroughs, coordinating public agencies and departments, and managing public property. New York City
  

Mayor Eric Adams is head of the executive branch of New York City's government. Previously, Mayor
  

Adams has served the people of New York City as an NYPD officer, state senator, and Brooklyn borough
  

president. The Adams’ administration is leading the fight to serve the people of the greatest city in the
  

world, ensuring delivery of efficient and effective services, working to make New York City’s economy
  

stronger, reducing inequality, improving public safety, and making the city more affordable that meets
  

the needs of all New Yorkers. We value leadership, transparency, fairness, and efficiency as we actively
  

seek diverse talents from various sectors to join our team. For current job opportunities visit our careers
  

page.  

  



**The Team You’ll Work With:**
  

The Mayor’s Office for International Affairs serves as the liaison between the City and New York City’s
  

international community, which includes 193 Permanent Missions, 116 Consulates, and the
  

headquarters of the United Nations. The Office functions as a global platform from which the City can
  

promote its goals for a more just and equitable society, showcase the diversity of New Yorkers and share
  

best practices with the world. The Office also works to foster positive relations and to encourage
  

collaboration between the international community and New York City’s agencies and local
  

neighborhoods.


**The Problems You’ll Solve:**  

The Strategic Relationships Associate (SRA) will support the Deputy Commissioner for Policy and
  

Strategic Initiatives and the Commissioner in carrying out a strategic effort to highlight the work of city
  

agencies and their best practices, including through joint programming and partnerships with city
  

agencies, Consulates, Permanent Missions and the United Nations. The SRA will be responsible for
  

developing and implementing a plan for the Office’s collaboration with New York City agencies and
  

outreach to New Yorkers through various platforms. The SRA will also play a critical role in delivering on
  

the Office’s core operational and protocol obligations, including facilitating the visits of delegations from
  

governments (municipal, state, federal) around the world, while continuing to foster the strong
  

relationship between the broad diplomatic community and the City.

  



**Working closely with the Deputy Commissioner for Policy and Strategic Initiatives & Chief of Staff and**  

**colleagues, the SRA will:**

* Develop and implement an annual strategic plan for collaboration between NYC agencies, the

international community, and NYC communities *(i.e. through community boards, community*  

*groups, etc.)*;
* Cultivate opportunities to share the work of the NYC Mayor’s Office for International Affairs as

part of the broader work to promote equity and inclusion across the five boroughs;
* Facilitate training and information sharing related to NYC services in collaboration with NYC

agencies and the international community, mainly Consulates;
* Design content to foster a closer relationship between the Mayor’s Office for International

Affairs and relevant communities in NYC to bolster opportunities for service delivery in
  

collaboration with City agencies;
* Develop a network of contacts at agencies throughout City government, City institutions,

Permanent Missions, Consulates and the United Nations in order to generate ideas for
  

substance, commitments, and action and drive partnerships with the international community;
* Develop a network of contacts with key community groups and stakeholders across the five

boroughs;
* Provide support, including administrative support, related to visiting delegations of government

officials from around the world;
* Manage day-to-day administration and record-keeping related to partnerships, including data

entry, management of a strategic relationship database and maintaining relevant contacts;
* Work on other special projects as assigned.

**About You**
  

* You have experience in program development, implementation, and evaluation, particularly with
international projects and partners
  

* You have robust relationship management experience involving diverse groups and individuals in
NYC
  

* You have good knowledge of key stakeholders and constituencies in New York City government
and New York’s international community
  

* You have good facilitation and communications (written and oral) skills
* You have interest in community development and empowerment, community organizing,
promoting equity and resilience, and sustainable development desired
  

* You must have the ability to
a) work independently,
  

b) actively seek collaborations,
  

c) support colleagues in their work and
  

d) work in a multicultural, multilingual environment


* You must have excellent planning, project management, and organizational skills
* You must be results and solution-oriented
* You must have a demonstrated ability to acquire and understand new information/data rapidly
* Event planning experience preferred
* You have a Bachelor’s degree in relevant field preferred
* You have a minimum of 1-2 years of relevant work experience

  



**Salary**
  

The City of New York Office of the Mayor’s compensation package includes a market competitive salary,
  

equity for all full-time roles and exceptional benefits. Our cash compensation range for this role is
  

**$45,000 – $50,000.**

title: Domestic Violence Program - Social Worker Level V, LCSW BH - Requires Travel within Five Boroughs
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

Social Worker V provides supervision and support to DV Shelter caseworker and social workers and to H+H Level 2-4 Social Workers in the screening, assessment and referral of clients for mental health services by Heath and Hospital clinical team. Social Worker V provides care and coordinates services at a designated shelter location, the Family Justice Centers, or via Tele-Health.

Under general direction, with very wide latitude for independent judgment and decision making, in addition to performing the duties of the lower Assignment Levels, performs the following typical tasks:

* Provides professional clinical supervision through review of cases to assist and guide subordinate social service staff in assessment, referrals and treatments of DV shelter clients.
* Provides adult, children, and group psychotherapy including crisis and grief counseling at required level.
* Conducts intake assessment for all assigned DV referrals to determine care needs
* Collaborate with center staff and on-site service agencies related to clients’ clinical needs. Assist in facilitating referral for psychiatric care when appropriate.
* Supervises and mentors assigned SW II-IVs and peer counselors.
* Performs administrative duties including monitoring care metrics to ensure we are meeting Central Office targets.
* Monitors all patients in case load from referral to discharge to ensure good patient care
* Present intake data at weekly clinical meeting.
* Maintains and completes statistics of case activities as outlined or requested by Associate or Assistant Director.
* Provide trauma informed education and prevention to DV shelter staff as requested by Director.
* Determines work assignments to support DV providers across assigned shelter sites, coordinates work flow and duty assignments, and evaluates work performance of subordinate social service staff.
* Ensures patient records are stored securely, confidentially, and compliant with HIPAA standards. Interfaces with hospital Medical Records department as necessary.
* Attend all trainings and departmental meeting as requested.
* In the temporary absence of the supervisor may perform duties if requested.

Minimum Qualifications

1. Valid license as an LCSW issued by the NYSED, and two (2) years of supervisory experience, as described above.

Department Preferences

* Three years background at responsible management and administrative levels; or, An equivalent combination of training, educational background and experience in related fields and educational disciplines; and General knowledge of policies and programs utilized in the operation of a health care facility, ability to assimilate and analyze data, to recommend action based on analytical findings,and to assist in the solution of complex problems in health care administration and management

Special Note:

* Section 424-a of the New York Social Services Law requires an authorized facility to inquire whether a candidate for employment with child-care responsibilities has been the subject of a child abuse and maltreatment report. The facility has the discretion to assign a candidate who has been the subject of a child abuse and maltreatment report to a position with no child-care responsibilities.

KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:

* Experience with Domestic Violence and/or trauma population. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to work well in a multidisciplinary team setting. Familiarity with high-risk patients and cultural sensitivity in community settings. Familiarity with high-risk populations and community settings, demonstrated interest in maternal mental health. Administrative and research experience a plus. Child treatment also plus.
* Three (3) years’ experience in a supervisory setting, preferably in Behavioral Health Services
* Supervises and trains subordinate social workers and support staff
* Develops instructional materials and techniques
* Bilingual Spanish preferred. Other languages a plus.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

* clinical supervisiory: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* NYS LCSW (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Local Coordinator
description:
CIEE, Council on International Educational Exchange, is seeking Local Coordinators. **Please note you must live within 120 miles of the posted city. This individual will have a strong network to generate their own host family leads. Although this position is posted as remote, please note that you would need to conduct bi-monthly check ins with students (in person).** As a CIEE Local Coordinator, you help coordinate school and host family placements for international high school students in your local community. You also work with regional staff to coordinate supervision and support for students and families throughout the duration of the exchange program. CIEE Local Coordinators are passionate about bringing the world closer together, increasing inter-cultural awareness, and finding safe and welcoming homes in their community for international exchange students.

Primary Responsibilities:

a. Recruit and select host families in your area

b. Match students with host families

c. Build and maintain relationships with local schools

d. Provide support and guidance to students and host families throughout the experience

e. Serve as a Liaison between local students, families, and schools and our professional support staff

Knowledge and Skills:

Successful candidates for the Local Coordinator position possess the following qualities and skills: Creativity, patience, persistence, strong social skills and the ability to work with all people. Ability to problem-solve, network, communicate effectively, and act objectively, within CIEE and Department of State guidelines. An understanding of cultural differences is helpful, as well as a desire to work with international youth.

Training and Support:

CIEE provides comprehensive Training for Local Coordinators to prepare them for all aspects of the position including, but not limited to: placements, supervision and support, conflict mediation and resolution, sales/outreach, and intercultural training. Regional Staff members work directly with Local Coordinators to guide them through initial training modules and provide additional support and training throughout the year.

**Hours/ Compensation:**

**This position is** ***not*** **salaried, and indeed determines and estimate. There is no cap to earnings;** Local Coordinators can receive financial compensation in the form of placement & supervision fees, bonuses, and all-inclusive travel incentives. As a Local Coordinator, you manage your own schedule and have flexible hours; many of our current local coordinators have full time jobs, are stay at home moms and dads, or are retired.

***Must be 25 years of age to apply.***

Follow this link to start your application today: https://www.ciee.org/partner/hosts/local-coordinators/become-local-coordinator

title: Registered Nurse - Medical Surgical
description:
Overview:

The Registered Professional Nurse is responsible and accountable for prescribing, delegating and coordinating all nursing care as defined by The New York State Nursing Practice Act. Comprehensive Medical/Surgical nursing care focuses on helping each patient to achieve their optimum health potential. This is achieved within the framework of the nursing process. The Medical/Surgical Registered Professional Nurse is responsible and renders services to Adult Medical/Surgical patients ranging from 18 years and older.
Responsibilities:

In accordance with professional nursing standards and practices, the Medical/Surgical nurse will provide nursing care to all patients with medical and surgical diagnoses.
The Medical/Surgical Nurse is responsible and accountable for the nursing care of the patients. **A****ssessment**:* Assesses patient’s physical, social and behavioral, mental status through direct observation, interview, and medical record review.
* Utilizes observational skills to assess patient’s needs.
* Documents a nursing assessment to include psychosocial, environmental factors, educational level and needs.
* Obtains and reviews available data base and any data collected by other members of the health team (medical/surgical/other history, physical exam mental status, therapist reports and community referrals).
* Identifies medical problems resulting from mental illness and use of medications.
* Communicates findings with other members of the health team. (Social Worker, Case managers, therapist, physician).

**P****lanning*** Identifies and addresses needs for admission based on acute medical/surgical diagnoses and presenting physical/psychological symptoms
* Identifies and addresses patient level of education, learning needs.
* Makes appropriate referral to other disciplines and documents same.

**Intervention/Implementation:*** Management of clinical skills in the provision of nursing care and management of the patient including but not limited to:
	+ Identification of symptoms
	+ Management of the disease entity
	+ Treatment modalities
	+ Administration of medications
* Intervenes appropriately in medical/surgical emergencies utilizing non-violent crisis intervention.
* Utilizes infection control procedures; collaborates with the infection control department in preventing and controlling infection control.
* Practices infection control: personal hygiene; hand washing; and dress code
* Provides for psychosocial and educational needs of all medical/surgical patients.
* Provides health teaching and medication instructions.
* Ensures that all procedures are performed based on established standards of care
* Demonstrates competency in performing all procedures within the scope of practice and in accordance with Interfaith Medical Center.
* Investigates and communicates all required information regarding unusual occurrences or patient care incidents.
* Acts as a patient advocate.

**Evaluation:*** Revises the patient’s plan of care based on evaluation of the interventions and expected outcomes in collaboration with other members of the health care team.


Qualifications:
**Education:*** Associate degree in nursing required and bachelor’s degree in nursing preferred.

**Experience:*** Minimum three (3) years' medical-surgical nursing experience preferred.

**Knowledge and Skills:**

* Ability to communicate effectively in English both verbally and in writing

**Licenses, Certifications:**

* Current NY State RN License required.
* Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) required.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Involves standing, walking, sitting, talking, hearing and bending.
* May include some repetitive motions.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position without compromising patient care.

 *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* *The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Interfaith Medical Center (IMC).* *IMC is an equal opportunity employer, it is our policy to provide equal opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, marital status, military status, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or handicap or other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Copywriter - Fashion Brand
description:
Join our dynamic team at Infinity Classics as a Creative Copywriter and unleash your creativity in the world of marketing and advertising. We are seeking a talented individual who is versatile and can develop a brand voice for each of our lines and ensure a consistent tone across all brand communications. Communication vehicles will include web copy, magazine and newspaper ads, direct mail, seasonal “catalogues,” press and design concept statements, in-store collateral and invitations, video scripts, product descriptions/naming projects, and more. The Copywriter will also collaborate with our design, digital and social media teams to create consistent brand messaging across platforms. Ideal candidate is someone who has mastery over the written word, an analytical mindset, and who is seeking to be an innovator through storytelling. If you have experience in a fashion or beauty company, we are very interested to meet you!

Brand website: memoi.com

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Write clear, detailed copy that also embodies our brand DNA
* Collaborate with the creative team
* Research SEO and SEM-rich copy to enhance product visibility in natural search for every product description
* Conduct thorough research on industry trends, target demographics, and competitors to enhance content quality
* Write and edit copy including product descriptions for web, create keyword-rich content and tagline that are optimized for SEO
* Write and edit compelling marketing emails, including subject lines, with the goal to maximize open rate, click-through rate and conversion
* Write and edit engaging copy and content for all social platforms that are native to each channel for the most amplification and engagement
* Write and edit weekly blogs
* Research and write technical product copy for website to include compelling features & benefits, care instructions and relevant trend/style information.
* Own, develop and maintain the brand copy guidelines and maintain the brand tone of voice across multiple channels, ensuring consistency
* Write copy for packaging, new product launches, event invites, in-store signage or any other customer or industry-facing asset
* Edit and proofread copy to ensure accuracy, clarity, and consistency

**QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:**

* Retail & Fashion apparel experience preferred
* Exceptional skill in writing, rewriting, copy-editing and proofreading
* Excellent grammar and attention to detail
* Excellent communication, and organization skills
* Strong conceptual skills with intuitive knowledge of how copy relates to design, graphics and concept inspiration
* 2+ years of experience in copywriting and/or content strategy development & implementation, brand experience a plus
* An innate understanding of content that will be successful for our target audiences and how copy impacts SEO
* Able to meet deadlines with ease while working on multiple projects

TO APPLY:

If you are a creative wordsmith with a flair for storytelling and a passion for marketing, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume along with samples of your work showcasing your copywriting skills.

Competitive salary based on experience.

title: Branch Administrative Assistant
description:
CrossCountry Mortgage (CCM) is the nation's number one distributed retail mortgage lender with more than 7,000 employees operating over 700 branches and servicing loans across all 50 states, D.C. and Puerto Rico. Our company has been recognized ten times on the Inc. 5000 list of America's fastest-growing private businesses and has received many awards for our standout culture.

**A culture where you can grow!** CCM has created an exceptional culture driving employee engagement, exceeding employee expectations, and directly impacting company success. At our core, our entrepreneurial spirit empowers every employee to be who they are to help us move forward together. You’ll get unwavering support from all departments and total transparency from the top down.

CCM offers eligible employees a competitive compensation plan and a robust benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, as well as a 401K. We also offer company-provided short-term disability, an employee assistance program, and a wellness program.

**Position Overview:**

The Branch Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative support and handling various operational functions to ensure the branch is operating in an efficient manner. Provide high-level support to Branch Manager including calendar management, successful coordination of business meetings, email management, and business tracking. Exercise independent judgment in the resolution of administrative needs and prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. This position requires on-site support in Fairfield, CT.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Manage team’s and branch manager’s calendar; schedule a variety of business meetings via platforms such as Teams, Zoom, and Outlook.
* Manage emails, letters, packages, phone calls and other forms of correspondence.
* Arranging travel and reservations as needed.
* Independently create well-organized, grammatically correct emails.
* Use various software applications such as spreadsheets and relational databases to keep management and teams informed on clients and deals.
* Perform administrative duties such as conducting research, updating databases/CRM, and tracking tasks for follow-up.
* Support all East Coast branches in day-to-day operations, such as opening and tracking support tickets, resolving billing, and following up on outstanding documents.
* Assist branches with onboarding and offboarding procedures.
* Various personal administration tasks, as needed.
* Complete expense reports and reconcile receipts.
* Assist colleagues whenever there is an opportunity to do so.
* Highly organized and understand the importance of confidentiality.

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office.
* Previous banking, financial services, or mortgage experience preferred, but not required.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Willingness to cross-train in various departments.

title: Apprentice Technician
description:
**Hudson Toyota, a Penske Automotive Group dealership, is looking for an Apprentice Technician to join our team and deliver extraordinary customer experiences.**


**JOIN OUR TEAM**  

At Penske Automotive Group (PAG), we strive to create a positive and challenging workplace that promotes excellence and achievement, and we aim to deliver the very best experience possible to our customers. We are looking for dedicated and motivated professionals with that same passion to join our team.



Imagine working in a professionally and financially satisfying job where you have the opportunity to make a positive impact on our organization and customers every day. As an Apprentice Technician, you will diagnose and perform repairs on all vehicle components under the direction of a senior or master Technician. This is a wonderful opportunity to begin your journey to a Master Technician career!


**WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER**


* Fortune 500 company, consistently recognized by Automotive News as among the "Best Dealerships to Work For."
* Proudly named to Glassdoor's Best Places to Work
* Comprehensive benefits program, including health care options (medical, dental, and vision) and 401k savings and retirement plan with company match.
* Training, resources, and opportunities for career growth and advancement tailored to individual performance, experience, and interests.
* Values-driven culture built on integrity, professionalism, excellence, and teamwork.


**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**


* Genuine interest in providing an exceptional customer experience.
* Friendliness, enthusiasm, reliability, with a positive "team-player" attitude.
* Strong work ethic with the ability to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
* Safe working knowledge of shop tools and equipment.


**WHAT YOU CAN BRING TO THE TABLE**


* Commitment: Ensure our customers have a world-class service experience at every step along their ownership journey, especially in vehicle repairs.
* Willingness to Learn: Be a self-starter and problem-solve independently, while utilizing the knowledge and expertise of your mentor to advance your technical understanding and work experience.
* Communication: Clearly and effectively communicate technical information regarding customer vehicles to Service Advisors.
* Accountability: Comply with all manufacturer standards of quality and timeliness for repairs and maintenance work, and ensure that all estimates and work orders are accurate.
* Safety: Understand and comply with all federal, state, and local regulations that affect shop operations, such as handling and disposal of hazardous waste, OSHA, and the use of safety and health personal protective equipment.


**APPLY WITH US!**



If you are ready for a rewarding career with competitive compensation and benefits, and opportunities to excel and advance, consider joining the Penske Automotive Group organization. Our interview process typically includes a phone interview, several in-person interviews, background check, reference check, driving record review, and a drug screen. Be a part of the best customer experience team in the automotive industry... apply with us today!



Penske Automotive Group is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a drug- and alcohol-free workplace. Some positions may require applicants to possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.

title: Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician Union (N)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring Behavior Technicians In Union, NJ.

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Director of Social Services-79544301
description:
**NOTE: All applicants must comply with ICL”s vaccination policy. Individuals selected for employment cannot begin working until they provide verification that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (with an FDA-authorized vaccine).**


**JOB SUMMARY:**



Direct the social services staff to provide counseling, entitlement, health and educational programs and social services. Coordinate clinical services on site.


**ESSENTIAL TASKS:** *To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty listed satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions unless this causes undue hardship to the agency.*


* Ensure adequate mental health, medical, social services, housing placement and substance abuse services for all clients
* Control the quality of services through formal supervision, case conferences and consultation to ensure a high standard of services
* Evaluate assessment documentation and establish criteria for program admission
* Communicate with referral agencies on admission criteria and bed vacancies
* Review charts and database entries
* Work with program director and staff to support clinical work
* Establish an ongoing training program and staff development to ensure professional and informed service
* Implement casework policies and procedures to ensure continuity of services
* Manage collection and analysis of client and program data to generate reports and evaluate programs
* Intervene in major crises to ensure the well-being of staff and clients
* Provide technical assistance to case management team as needed
* Work jointly with contract medical / mental health providers to ensure timely delivery of services


Provides supervision and oversight to supervisory clinical staff (see positions supervised above)


* Manages the completion of time clock edits of staff who report to this position.
* Monitors subordinates’ compliance with the agency's time and attendance policy; recommends disciplinary action for those out of compliance.
* Completion of performance evaluations.
* Conducts staff supervision in the absence of the Program Manager.
* Assists with disciplinary actions by participating in disciplinary counseling, completing disciplinary action reports, and recommending employee terminations as needed.
* Monitors whether staff have attended required in-service training and schedules employees to attend both in-service training and training provided by vendors; conducts training on clinical subjects, charting, fire safety plan, fire drills, emergency plans and procedures, building security, volunteers and interns, and site specific exposure control plan.
* Promotes positive employee morale and a culture of compliance in the work environment to stop or eliminate sexual harassment or any form of employee harassment or employee discrimination; responsible for taking complaints of sexual harassment, informing the Human Resources Department of the complaint, and investigating the complaint (as directed).
* Monitors employee accrual totals, approves or recommends approval of employee requests for time off, and notifies the Department of Human Resources when an employee should be placed on or taken off Family and Medical Leave (FMLA). Maintains contact with staff while out on FMLA.
* Participates in employment interviews that meet federal, state, and agency regulatory guidelines.
* Has on-call responsibility.
* Perform other duties as assigned


**ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**


* Knowledge of the management process, especially as it applies to not-for-profit organizations
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office software
* Effective staff management skills: Planning, scheduling, assigning and directing of work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining; and addressing complaints and resolving problems.; selecting, training and developing employees; directing employees toward desired objectives; delegating, motivating, and controlling the essential work functions (e.g. developing performance standards, measuring results, taking corrective action)
* Effective organizational skills (e.g. planning, scheduling, prioritizing tasks, organizing and allocating resources)
* Financial/accounting skills sufficient to understand the program’s budget and related financial reports
* Effective college-level problem-solving skills
* Effective interpersonal skills
* Ability to work with diverse individuals
* Ability to work as a member of a team
* Ability to make reasonable and sound evaluative judgments
* Ability to create, compose, and edit written materials, including business reports and correspondence
* Ability to read and understand government regulations
* Ability to effectively and efficiently respond to questions from employees
* Ability to present information to executive management, persons served, and employees


**MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:**


Master’s or Doctoral degree in Human Services field (Social Work, Psychology, Nursing, Rehab Counseling, Counseling, etc.) plus a minimum of 3 years progressive supervisory experience in a human services setting.


**PREFERRED EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:**

* NYS Education Department Licensure in professional field.
* Experience with treatment planning and DHS regulations
* Ability to supervise case managers and their written work. Coaching when according.

**Long Island STEAM Group** is looking for energetic and dynamic individuals to conduct fun and engaging after-school STEAM programs (science and chess topics) during the 2024-2025 Fall/Winter/Spring semesters at various elementary schools across Long Island. A teaching or education background is a plus, but is not required. This is a part-time position for 3 to 5 afternoons per week at 2 hours per day.

* Good communication skills, attention to detail, and a joyful approach to teaching
* Experience working with children ages 5-12
* Access to reliable transportation and willingness to travel within a 15 mile radius of your home
* Outgoing and engaging personality

* Flexible schedule to fit your needs
* Very competitive salary - $45 per workshop

* An opportunity to get children excited about learning

Long Island STEAM Group is an organization encompassing several educational and entertaining programs for pre- and elementary school children. We are the provider of Mad Science, Crayola Imagine Arts Academy, Schoolhouse Chess, and Brixology, and have been bringing leaning programs to the children of Long Island for over 18 years. We take pride in merging education with entertainment with engaging presentations for children when they are most receptive to learning. Having fun while learning is evident throughout every assembly, workshop, birthday party, summer camp, and after-school enrichment program we offer. We are always seeking highly energetic and dynamic individuals to conduct fun workshops and shows throughout the year at schools and camps around Long Island. title: Barista - Eataly Flatiron
description:
**Company Description**  

Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace! Eataly is not a chain; each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counters
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

  

**Job Description**  

A Barista creates and serves specialty hot and cold beverages according to Eataly’s recipes and guests’ special requests. A Barista is knowledgeable about all coffee menu items, provides high-quality, fast-paced service and is able to work at multiple QSR counters performing various functions. Reports to the QSR General Manager and the QSR Assistant General Managers.

* Prepares and serves authentic Italian espresso, coffee and other café drinks at multiple counters
* Provides guests with exceptional service and product details, such as coffee blend or preparation description
* Sets up stations and replenishes displays neatly including separation of allergens (nuts, wheat, etc.)
* Ensures all items are dated and following First in First Out (FIFO) standards
* Weighs, grinds or packs coffee beans for guests according to their specifications
* Operates the Point of Sales (POS) system ensuring accuracy of cash drops and authenticity of bills
* Cleans and sanitizes work areas in accordance with supervising health agency of the area
* Works across all QSR counters serving pastry, gelato, pizza and other Italian delicacies
* Maintains a calm demeanor during periods of high volume
* Performs other duties as required or assigned

  

**Qualifications**  

* Knowledgeable and enthusiastic about coffee, tea and drink preparation, and product
* Outstanding communication and guest service skills
* Ability to perform simple mathematical calculations and follow directions for all production
* 1+ year barista experience on a manual espresso machine preferred
* High school diploma preferred

**Job Requirements**

* Availability to work onsite with a flexible schedule often including early mornings, evenings and weekends
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
* Ability to exert well-paced mobility for up to 8 hours, including standing, walking, bending and squatting
* Ability to operate equipment such as manual espresso machine, ovens, drink blender, juicer and Point of Sale
* Dexterity for rapid and consistent espresso creation

  

**Additional Information** **Benefits and Perks**

* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* 401K with match or RRSP
* Bonus program
* Free family meal daily
* Discounts at Eataly
* Classes on products and Italian cuisine
* Referral bonus program
* and more!


The base pay for this position is $17 per hour plus tips.


Eataly is an equal employment opportunity employer. It is the Company’s policy to not unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic made unlawful to consider by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Eataly also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also Eataly’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding consideration of unemployment status, salary history, credit/bankruptcy history and criminal background/conviction history in making hiring decisions. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.
