title: Contracts Technician
description:
Interested in joining the Parks team? Do you have experience in Contracts review, preparation, interpretation or administration? The Parks Department has an opening for the position of Contracts Technician.  

  

Minimum Requirements  

Graduation from a standard senior high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma, and three (3) years of experience in maintaining financial records, accounts, or journals, budgeting, or contract and/or claims processing, one (1) year of which must have involved contracts review, preparation, interpretation or administration.  

  

Applications due by August 30,2024  

  

Under supervision, an employee in this class reviews, maintains and modifies contractual and compliance records and related materials. The work differs from that of a Budget Technician in that the incumbent's primary responsibility is concerned with administering the various contracts derived from the budget process in accordance with local, state and federal regulations. Work is performed in accordance with established guidelines and procedures. Supervision may be exercised over a small clerical staff, and is received from an administrative supervisor. Does related work as required.* Reviews and administers contracts in accordance with federal, state and local rules and regulations;
* Makes suggestions concerning the revision of language in contracts;
* Reviews claims for payment and for conformance to contracts;
* Ascertains whether claims are charged to the proper accounts in regard to related contracts;
* Maintains files for contract records and reports;
* Monitors contracts to insure that all provisions in them are complied with.

*Target Salary: $41,421** This position does not offer relocation assistance at this time


\\*\\*Sponsorship is not available for this role*FULL PERFORMANCE KNOWLEDGES, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS** Good knowledge of federal, state and local regulations pertaining to contracts
* Good knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of contract administration
* Good knowledge of contract terminology and procedures
* Some knowledge of auditing, accounting and claims processing procedures applicable to contracts
* Some knowledge of standard office methods and procedures
* Ability to analyze statistical information and to make arithmetic computations rapidly and accurately
* Ability to establish effective working relationships with co-workers in a manner conducive to full performance and high morale
* Ability to compile and prepare clear and accurate reports
* Ability to express oneself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
* Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the position.

*This Role Is A Provisional Appointment*
A provisional appointment, which occurs only in the competitive class, is a temporary appointment to a position for which no eligible list exists or for which an eligible list exists with fewer than three candidates who are willing to accept the position. In order to become permanent, the employee who is provisionally appointed must take the next examination for the position in question. The appointment to the position is then made from among the three highest scoring passing candidates who indicate their willingness to accept the position. Civil Service law does not compel the appointing authority to choose the provisional employee should he or she be one of the three candidates.

title: Kindergarten Teacher
description:
**About us**

Ivy Primary Prep is a small business in Jersey City, NJ. We are professional, agile, engaging and our goal is to IVY Primary Preps goal is to hire an enthusiastic kindergarten teacher to foster and facilitate the intellectual and social development of the children. .

Our work environment includes:

* Safe work environment
* On-the-job training
* Growth opportunities

\\*\\*Kindergarten Teacher\\*\\*

IVY Primary Prep in Jersey City is looking for a dedicated and passionate Kindergarten Teacher to join our team. As a Kindergarten Teacher at IVY Primary Prep, you will play a crucial role in fostering the academic and social development of our young students.

\\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\*

* Develop and implement engaging lesson plans that align with the school's curriculum and educational standards.
* Create a positive and nurturing classroom environment that promotes learning and growth.
* Conduct assessments to monitor students' progress and adjust teaching strategies accordingly.
* Maintaining grades for the students and discussing progress with parents
* Maintain accurate records of student attendance, performance, and behavior.
* Using games, music, artwork, films, books, computers and other tools to teach basic educational and social skills
* Using play-based learning and hands-on teaching methods
* Teaching letter recognition, phonics, numbers and awareness of nature and science
* Integrating competencies, goals and objectives into lesson plans
* Monitoring children’s interactions and nurturing cooperation and sharing
* Working closely with administration, staff and other Teachers
* Encouraging creativity by organizing art and craft projects
* Utilize various teaching methods to cater to different learning styles within the classroom.
* Incorporate physical education, special education, and Montessori principles into daily activities.
* Plan and organize classroom activities, including field trips, to enhance the learning experience.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

* - Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education or a related field (Master's preferred).
* - Minimum of 3 years of experience teaching in a kindergarten or early childhood setting.
* - Proficiency in lesson planning, standardized testing, and child welfare practices.
* - Strong communication skills to interact effectively with students, parents, and colleagues.
* If you are enthusiastic about shaping young minds and creating a supportive learning environment for kindergarten students, we invite you to apply for the Kindergarten Teacher position at IVY Primary Prep. Join us in making a difference in the lives of our students every day.

title: Client Acquisition Specialist
description:
Client Acquisition Specialist – Government Outreach

About Us:  
At Medical Essential Diagnostics, we are committed to improving the health and well-being of our communities by providing essential cardiopulmonary diagnostic screenings to first responders, educators, and state employees across New Jersey. We are expanding our outreach and are looking for a motivated Client Acquisition Representative to join our team.

Role Overview:  
As a Client Acquisition Representative in our Government Outreach team, you will play a crucial role in building relationships with key NJ state departments, including Police, Fire, Municipal, Public Works, and more. Your primary responsibility will be to make outbound calls to schedule information sessions, where our field marketers can present our life-saving programs and secure preregistrations. This is not just a sales job; it’s an opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of those who serve our community.

Key Responsibilities:  
- Conduct cold calls to various NJ state departments, including Police, Fire, Municipal, and Public Works, to set up informational sessions.  
- Build and maintain relationships with key contacts within these departments.- Participate in weekly meetings to discuss performance, progress, goals, and strategy.  
- Collaborate with field marketers to ensure successful execution of information sessions.  
- Track and report on outreach efforts and session scheduling.  
- Consistently meet and exceed outreach and scheduling goals.

Why Join Us?  
- Guaranteed Hourly Pay + Uncapped Bonus Structure: Your hard work will directly impact your earnings, with no limit to what you can achieve.Here’s a reworded version of those points for the job description:  
- Advance at Your Own Pace: We believe in recognizing and supporting top performers. Your growth and advancement are directly tied to your success—excel and you’ll be rewarded.  
- Team Success Rewards: Our "High Five Program" offers a lucrative incentive structure that celebrates both individual achievements and team-based success.  
- Paid Time Off & Sick Time: We value work-life balance and offer generous PTO and sick time.  
- Open and Collaborative Work Environment: Join a team that values collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.  
- Career Growth Opportunities: As we continue to grow, so will your opportunities for advancement.

What We’re Looking For:  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.  
- Ability to handle rejection and remain positive.  
- Previous experience in sales, particularly cold calling, is a plus but not required.  
- Passion for making a difference in the community.

How to Apply:  
If you’re excited about the opportunity to be part of a mission-driven organization and want to thrive in a dynamic sales role, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team and help us make a difference in the lives of New Jersey’s first responders, educators, and state employees.

title: Lead Registered Behavior Technician
description:
First Children Services is currently seeking a Behavior Technician (BT) to join our team! We are a family-owned, family-operated, and family-focused organization. Our STRIVE Autism Center is a multi-site, behavioral health and ABA center. At STRIVE, we provide diagnostic evaluations, followed with evidence-based therapeutic services such as psychotherapy and ABA. While also providing full circle support through behavioral parent training and outreach. We are a passionate and dynamic group; unique for our eclectic, fun and collaborative spirit while still adhering to a high-quality, evidence-based practice. Join FCS in a rewarding field, where we set our staff up for success!

**Position Summary:** The Lead RBT is a full-time position whose primary role is the support of the STRIVE clinic. He/She will be a leader and will provide supervision and oversight of the clinic staff when the BCBA is not present. The Lead RBT is responsible for following the master clinic schedule, developing clinic lesson plans, and updating targets and objectives as appropriate.. The Lead RBT is also responsible for implementing the goals and objectives outlined in the individual treatment plans and behavior supports plans. The Lead RBT will maintain confidential files and will ensure that all clinic services are provided in a caring and respectful way in keeping with all relevant policies and procedures. The Lead RBT will assist BCBAs with completing skill and behavioral assessments, writing programs, modeling interventions, and providing training / support to those who work with individual learners.

 **Job Responsibilities Clinical Responsibilities:**

* Maintains a minimum of 28 billable hours/week based on staffing and other organizational needs
* Provides direct clinical services to assigned caseload as outlined in IEPs or insurance authorizations
* Provides additional ABA therapy sessions as needed, including working as a substitute therapist on cases requiring coverage
* Records data following measurement systems outlined on datasheets and in electronic data collection systems
* Completes all required paperwork for direct services
* Scores at least 80% on monthly feedback tools assessing consistent and accurate implementation of clinical programming

**Program Management and Clinic Oversight:**

* Assists BCBAs with creating, maintaining, and updating program materials


- Assists the clinic team with providing training to new therapists, including creating synchronous, on-site training opportunities and demonstrating fluency with Behavior Skills Training techniques - Organizes and maintains program materials and resources at assigned clinic location

* Assists the clinic team with creating and building programming on Central Reach
* Assists the clinic team with skill and behavioral assessments, including taking baseline data, probing skills, and summarizing assessment data for treatment plans
* Assists the clinic team with the completion of required clinical documents, including FBAs, BSPs, individual treatment plans, and insurance authorizations
* Develops, organizes, and oversees group activities in the clinic
* Ensures group activities are functional, age-appropriate, and align with individual treatment plan goals
* Assumes the role of the supervisor on duty in the absence of the Clinic Director and remains physically on-site in the center during client hours in the absence of the Director; collaborates with the Director to ensure a supervisor is available to open and close the clinic each day
* Ensures BTs/RBTs maintain appropriate engagement with their clients and follow the clinic schedule and adhere to relevant policies and procedures while the supervisor on duty
* Ensures all clients receive quality clinical programming within assigned clinic
* Ensures all clients have meaningful access to socialization opportunities with peers and participate in group instruction and activities at their skill level
* Ensures client programs and schedules are individualized to each client while still aligned with the overall programming/schedule of the clinic
* Ensures all staff remain fully engaged and interactive with their clients at the clinic, including actively contriving learning opportunities and engaging with toys/materials in new and creative ways
* Fosters a fun learning environment for all children served within assigned clinic
* Ensures physical clinic environment meets regulatory standards, including compliance and cleaning standards within First Children’s Health & Safety Audit
* Ensures physical clinic is neatly decorated in kid friendly, engaging materials (i.e., with a variety of sensory modalities) aligned with weekly/monthly themes

 **Supporting Responsibilities:**

* Meets with direct supervisor on a regular, pre-determined schedule (minimally once a week)
* Creates schedule on CentralReach one week prior to service delivery
* Completes all required paperwork for direct services
* Converts appointments to his/her timesheet on CentralReach as soon as possible after the appointment
* Submits required paperwork for billing
* Completes 20 hours of training annually

o PA or NJ Child Abuse Clearance

title: Security Guard/Receptionist - 76th Street Building
description:
Job Title: Security Guard/Receptionist - 76th Street Building  

Department: Security  

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt  

The Hewitt School - New York, NY  

  

ABOUT HEWITT  

  

Established in 1920 and located in New York City, The Hewitt School is an independent K-12 girls’ school whose mission is to inspire girls and young women to become game changers and ethical leaders who forge an equitable, sustainable, and joyous future. Hewitt empowers and expects our community members to embrace multiple points of view, engage others with empathy and integrity, and to champion equity and justice in all areas of our lives. As a community, Hewitt is fully committed to a culturally diverse faculty, staff, and student body.  

POSITION SUMMARY  

  

The Hewitt School seeks a security guard/receptionist for the 2024-2025 school year. The security guard/receptionist for the 76th Street school building reports to the director of technology and campus operations and is responsible for the safety and security of Hewitt students, faculty, staff, and facilities.  

  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES
* Demonstrated commitment to anti-bias education and social justice
* Ensure the security and safety of faculty, staff, and students at The Hewitt School
* Ensure the security of The Hewitt School buildings and property
* Perform duties of fire and emergency drill conductor
* Perform duties of fire guard and event safety officer
* Assist in lock down, fire, and emergency drills
* Perform duties of a licensed security professional on the Hewitt campus and at special events
* Inspect the physical security of the School to ensure all entrances and exits are secured
* Maintain access control to Hewitt by interviewing visitors, establishing proper identification, directing visitors to sign the “visitors log” when appropriate, and distributing visitor passes
* Distribute mail, answer telephone calls, and transfer calls when appropriate
* Familiarity with The Hewitt School crisis management plan
* Conduct a visual and vertical patrol of the school building upon arrival, at the end of the day, and whenever necessary to ensure building security and safety
* Perform security/reception duties at the front desk
* Monitor dismissal at the end of the school day to ensure an orderly and safe departure of the students from the school, and assist in safely loading and unloading students on school buses
* Observe the security monitor and camera systems on a regular basis to ensure the safety and security of students, faculty, and staff
* Understand the building alarm system and communicate with the alarm company as necessary to ensure the alarm system is functioning properly and is upgraded as necessary
* Ensure the security of valuable equipment such as laptops, cameras, spare cell phones, etc.
* Prepare reports and memos as needed to properly document incidents affecting the School
* Communicate by cell phone or portable radio with Hewitt administrators, security, faculty, and staff to improve efficiency, safety, and coordination of effort
* Respond to emergencies involving the School and take appropriate action to restore normalcy
* Monitor “alerts” distributed by the Office of Emergency Management and take appropriate action
* Other assignments as directed by the director of technology and campus operations

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
* High school diploma or equivalent
* New York State Security Guard License
* CPR/AED certification
* Fire and Emergency Drill Conductor for NYC K-12 Non-Public Schools Certificate (D20)
* Working knowledge of Google Docs
* Excellent communication skills

QUALIFICATIONS DESIRED
* Commitment to student life
* NYC Fire Department Certificate of Fitness (COF)
* Indoor Place of Assembly Safety Personnel Certificate (F3)
* Temporary Indoor/Outdoor Place of Assembly Safety Personnel Certificate (FO4)
* Supervision of Fire Alarm Systems Certificate (S95)
* FEMA Certificate of Introduction to Incident Command System for Schools (ICS-100)

SPECIAL POSITION REQUIREMENTS
* Ability to move equipment in excess of 25 pounds

SALARY RANGE
Starting Salary Range: $23.00 to $27.00 per hour (salary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience and expertise)  

  

TO APPLY: Please submit a resumé, cover letter, and examples of previous relevant work via our applicant tracking portal. Cover letters should reflect a careful reading of The Hewitt School’s website, including the School’s academic philosophy. No phone calls, please. Recruitment will remain open until the position is filled; applicants should apply as soon as possible for consideration.  

  

IMPORTANT INFORMATION  

  

The Hewitt School is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the School not to discriminate on the basis of any category prohibited by applicable federal, New York State and/or New York City laws/regulations. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment process, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation/benefits, performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, training, working conditions, layoff, and termination.

title: Front Desk Office Administrator
description:
Nazaire Company is looking for an organized and goal-oriented Office Administrator to keep our business's operations running smoothly. The primary responsibilities of a Front desk Office Administrator are to complete clerical and administrative tasks for an office and also provide Customer Service. Their main duties include welcoming and directing visitors.

They answer the phone, respond to emails, greet potential clients, address complaints, and handle other front desk duties.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

· Answer phone and direct clients/prospects to the appropriate department and ensure to follow-up in a timely manner

- Manage emails, letters packages, phone calls and other forms of correspondence

· Diplomatically handle client complaints and refer them to the appropriate individual/department for resolution

· Ensure all company safety policies and procedures are strictly followed

· Responsible for daily filing and follow-ups with clients.

· Maintain confidentiality of client and company information at all times

Attend to clients with a clear, friendly voice along with a professional demeanor

Maintain and keep client areas tidy

· Responsible for stocking fresh complimentary snacks and beverages for office

· Attend to waiting clients.

**Qualifications**

· Outstanding abilities to communicate in person, in writing and over the phone

-Familiarity with common procedures and basic account principles used in the office

- Communication Skills: Require excellent oral communication skills to effectively communicate customers’ interest needs and requests to management and sales personnel; as well as written communication skills for filing and documentation.

· Language Skills: They require the ability to read and comprehend instructions and information

· Professionalism: They must present a professional personal appearance at all times and a polished communication style.

· Phone Handling Skills: They require appropriate phone handling etiquette for polite conversation with clients and prospects; and for promptly and efficiently handling a multi-line phone system.

· Flexibility: Must be willing and able to work various schedules.

· Interpersonal Skills: Require excellent interpersonal skills to relate easily with people of various background and personalities. It is also essential for them to work effectively with all departments with limited supervision.

- Excellent leadership, time management and organizational Skills

· Computer Skills: They require intermediate computer skills in Microsoft Word, Outlook and Excel. They also require strong keyboarding skills.

· Time-management: They must be punctual, with the ability to manage assigned tasks within time schedule; as well as provide customer support in a timely manner.

title: Pharmacy Enrollment Administrator - New Providence, NJ
description:
**Independent Pharmacy Enrollment Administrator**

*Contract Remote/Hybrid Role –* *Some Office Hours in New Providence, NJ*

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma, medical device and diagnostic companies get their therapies to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product’s value to payers, physicians, and patients. A significant part of our business is providing patient support programs on the behalf of our customers. With the right experience, you can help provide support to patients in need of available therapies.


IQVIA has the world’s largest Commercial Sales & Medical Solutions (CSMS) organization dedicated to the launch and marketing of pharmaceutical and medical products. With a focus on providing talent for patient support, field/inside sales, medical device support, clinical support, and medical affairs our CSMS division has 10,000+ field professionals in more than 30 countries addressing physician and patient needs.


We are excited to announce that currently we are looking for a 100% remote (work from home – WFH) contract **Independent Pharmacy Enrollment Administrator** to join our team. This role will be a contract role with IQVIA managed by an external agency, with the opportunity to be converted to an IQVIA full-time employee.

**Role Purpose:**

* Review and verify Independent Pharmacy, Specialty Pharmacies and Health Care facilities information prior to adding them to the IQVIA network.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Perform administrative duties with business responsibilities necessitating contact and exposure to confidential information requiring use of tact, diplomacy and discretion.
* Assist in researching and compiling specific data and compose pharmacy enrollment documentation for review and approval by management.
* Learn to utilize all required internal applications and navigate industry standard internet sights to support findings and recommendations.
* Maintain all assigned files are completed in guidelines of the department service level agreements.
* Receive, photocopy, distribute, and file a variety of incoming and outgoing correspondence and reports.
* Provide relevant data, information, and back-up support materials to assist manager with day to day operations, as requested.
* May track a variety of department performance data and complete regularly scheduled reports by required due date.
* Assist in preparation, obtain appropriate departmental signatures, track and follow up on various actions supporting the department.
* Ensure that communications are promptly and accurately dispatched.
* Responsible as a team member to ensure internal audits of the departments work meet documented Senior Leadership monthly requirements.
* Performs other duties as required.
* Provide initial support for customer requests via telephone, email, fax, or other available means of contact to the Support Center.
* Learns the technical skills necessary to answer and complete client requests and maintain logs and ensure follow through
* Develops the interpersonal skills necessary to build effective business relationships with defined clients
* Develops an understanding of clients’ potential business needs
* Develops the knowledge to ensure accurate and timely communication of support issues to relevant departments (i.e. Finance, Chain Pharmacy Support)
* Provides support to other team members
* Recognize operational challenges and suggest recommendations to management, as necessary.
* Hybrid role - Must be commutable to work weekly both remote and in our New Providence, NJ office - 40 hours per week (9 am – 6 pm EST) under moderate supervision

**Minimum Education & Experience:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 1 year of administrative experience required

**The pay range for this role is $18.00 per hour.**


IQVIA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We cultivate a diverse corporate culture across the 100+ countries where we operate, celebrating and rewarding teamwork and inclusiveness. By embracing our differences, we create innovative solutions that are good for IQVIA, our clients, and the advancement of healthcare everywhere. This role will be a contract role with IQVIA managed by an external agency, with the opportunity to be converted to an IQVIA full-time employee.

**#LI-CES**

**#LI-Remote**


IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com


We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe


IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding COVID-19 vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status

The actual base pay offered may vary based on a number of factors including job-related qualifications such as knowledge, skills, education, and experience; location; and/or schedule (full or part-time). Dependent on the position offered, incentive plans, bonuses, and/or other forms of compensation may be offered, in addition to a range of health and welfare and/or other benefits.

title: Customer Relations Specialist/Liaison
description:
Rasi Laboratories is a leading provider of turnkey manufacturing solutions to the dietary supplements industry. We are a consistently growing organization, and enjoy a stellar reputation for manufacturing quality supplements through our know-how and ability to leverage our longstanding raw material supply relationships. Rasi’s book of business consists of Fortune 500 companies and rapidly growing startups, and we are committed to providing our customers with top tier regulatory and market support as they navigate this evolving vertical.

As our customer needs grow and vary, Rasi needs a Customer Service Specialist/Liaison in order to effectively address all customer queries, in addition to providing quality assurance support. This position is a great opportunity for motivated individuals looking to transition into a growing industry with no prior experience necessary.

**Job responsibilities:**

The primary responsibility for this position is to field customer requests in addition to coordinating and liaising internally with responsible parties to ensure customer needs and requirements are being met. As part of this position, the right candidate will maintain a running list of open orders and balances. Additional tasks include:

* Keeping customers regularly informed regarding product manufacturing status through the creation and propagation of Open Order Reports (OOR).
* Communicating internally with responsible parties to gather appropriate information and to ensure accuracy of all OORs.
* Ensuring product label checklist requirements are signed off by each responsible person at the appropriate intervals of the manufacturing process.
* Maintaining records to ensure visibility into on-hand label inventory.
* Acting as the primary contact for customer inquiries regarding product manufacturing.
* Ensuring customer requirements are being met.
* Arranging and sending out samples to customers as needed.
* For a customer complaint, initiating applicable investigation documents and ensuring the completion of such documents while keeping appropriate records and informing the customer.
* Assisting in the preparation of shipping documents such as Bills of Lading and Packing Lists.
* Performing other related tasks as may be required.

**Key qualities we are looking for:** 

* Ability to effectively communicate, through verbal and written means, with key customer stakeholders at all levels of responsibility.
* Ability to listen/accept customer urgency, frustration, etc. without panic
* Well organized

· Self-starter with excellent time management skills

**Skills**

* Intermediate level ability to create, organize and manipulate data using Excel, along with familiarity with other Microsoft Office Suite products.
* Intermediate level algebra skills

* Day shift

title: Connections to Care Coordinator
description:
The Connections to Care: Building Resilience in Youth (C2C: BRY) is a 3 year grant funded through NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) and monitored through Public Health Solutions (PHS). The C2C: BRY program was developed in response to the significant need for youth mental health interventions in NYC, following the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The primary goal is to help increase CBO capacity to work with youths (ages 13-21 years) and improve their mental health and wellness through technical assistance, training and peer support via a learning collaborative. We have partnered with Sun River Health and Morris Heights Health Center to provide coaching for this initiative.

The Connections to Care Coordinator will assist the VP of Youth and Program Services in ensuring that homeless youths ages 13–21-year-old in TRIE neighborhoods (Morrisania/Crotona, Highbridge/Concourse and Fordham/University Heights) have access to mental health services through the C2C: BRY program. This is a 3 year grant funded role.

Position is subject to contract renewal beyond 2025. If the contract is renewed, the position will continue. If the contract is not renewed and with the assistance of HR, C2C staff can explore current employment opportunities within HSNY.

Salary is $60,000 per contract year.

**Goal and Objectives –** The goals and objectives of the *Connections to Care: Building Resilience in Youth* (C2C:BRY) program are to:

· Expand mental health knowledge, skills, and strategies among community-based organization (CBO) staff in Task Force on Racial Inclusion and Equity (TRIE)-designated neighborhoods to enhance their capacity to promote resilience and mental health awareness among youth in vulnerable communities;

· Enhance CBO capacity to identify mental health concerns and deliver brief evidence-based interventions to meet participant mental health needs. In addition, maintain proficient use of these mental health support skills by CBO staff across time;

· Develop a strong partnership between CBOs and select Mental Health Provider organizations (MHPs) to refer youth for mental health and related services when appropriate and enhance the effectiveness of the CBO referral process to a local MHP through strategies such as warm handoffs and service coordination;

· Improve mental health outcomes for participating youth; and

· Strengthen community coordination of services and resources through community engagement and partnerships with local CBOs and leaders to reach TRIE neighborhoods.

· Coordinate activities, as appropriate, with other TRIE community initiatives such as the Young Men’s Initiative (YMI), the New York City Civic Engagement Commission (CEC) and Brothers Thrive/Sisters Thrive.

**PRIMARY FUNCTION/PURPOSE:**

* Perform duties including outreach to youths (ages 13-21) and CBOs in specified neighborhoods to identify homeless youths who can benefit from mental health services.
* Participate in C2C: BRY Foundational training, webinars and workshops to support communication about BRY and to learn mental health task sharing.
* Complete screening, client education and referrals for youths who have been identified for the intervention.
* Develop a strong partnership between CBOs and Mental Health Providers (MHPs) to refer youth for mental health and related services when appropriate and with the goal of improving mental health outcomes for participating youths; strengthening community awareness and coordination of services and resources through community engagement and partnerships with local CBOs and community leaders.
* Collaborate with Mental Health Partners to provide this intervention to identified youths.
* Perform QA functions including tracking, monitoring, monthly reports, data collection to ensure that contract deliverables are met and that the program is performing at an optimal level.
* Compiles and submits monthly and/or quarterly program reports on all program accomplishments and challenges.
* Deliver mental health services including screening, assessment, client education, stress management counseling and referrals to C2C: BRY participants.
* Participate in the C2C:BRY learning collaborative with DOHMH, PHS, CUNY, CIMH to support continuous quality improvement and sustainability of the program.
* Document all engagement and outreach efforts to youths.
* Create a referral tracking system
* Participate in all C2C:BRY site visits and technical assistance meetings
* Attend Community Board meetings to promote C2C: BRY
* Other duties as assigned.

**PROBLEM-SOLVING:** Independently identifies and works with the MHP, HSNY Shelter Staff and VP of Youth and Program Services to resolve problems, determining solutions from established standards or procedures.

**KNOWLEDGE:** Job duties require a thorough familiarity with all department procedures and goals to assure work meets standard.

**FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY: Makes routine low-cost expenditures and identifies any needs for high cost expenditures to be approved by the VP of Social Services.**

**SUPERVISION:** Provides weekly supervision to EHP staff and holds consistent team meetings.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**

**Education: Bachelor’s** Degree in Social Work, Public Health, Mental Health, Human Services, Social Services or the equivalent.

**Experience:** 3-5 years of demonstrated program/contract management and oversight responsibilities in a social services agency preferred. Experience working with homeless youths. Experience supervising social services/human services staff in shelter/mental health/transitional or permanent supportive housing. Experience working with Department of Homeless Services (DHS), Human Resources Administration (HRA), or Department of Health.

**Other Requirements:**

Strong work ethic, intense drive, initiative for quality service

Solid computer skills; working knowledge of MS Office.

Ability to multi-task/ stay on task & maintain focus in high demand, fast-paced working environment.

Evidence of solid leadership and supervisory skills.

**Related Skills or Knowledge:** Excellent management, problem solving, organizational, and counseling skills required. Ability to analyze and evaluate information and develop recommendations. Demonstrated success in planning and implementing program activities within budgetary and time constraints. Requires excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to present information to a wide variety of audiences.

**Work Environment and Physical Demands**

The work environment described here is representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit, stoop, use hands or fingers, or feel objects, tools or controls, reach with hands and arms, climb stairs, balance, kneel, talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10-15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision and distance vision. Must be able to travel locally using public transportation.

**AGENCY EXPECTATIONS OF ALL EMPLOYEES**

Adheres to HSNY's Policies and Procedures. Acts as a role model within and outside the agency. Performs duties as workload necessitates. Attendance and Dependability: the employee can be depended on to report to work at the scheduled time and is seldom absent from work. Employee can be depended upon to complete work in a timely, accurate, and thorough manner and is conscientious about assignments. Communication and Contact: the employee communicates both verbally and in writing with superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside HSNY. Relationships with others: the employee works and communicates effectively and relates well with others including superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside HSNY. The employee exhibits a professional manner in dealing with others and works to maintain constructive working relationships. Employee adheres to mission statement and guiding principles.

Salary: $55,000 - $60,000

title: Corporate Program Associate
description:
**THE KOREA SOCIETY** is a nonprofit, nonpartisan, 501(c)(3) organization with individual and corporate members that is dedicated solely to the promotion of greater awareness, understanding, and cooperation between the people of the United States and Korea.

**Description:**

The Korea Society seeks a creative, self-motivated, organized person to fill a position in the Corporate Program team. This position will support all aspects of corporate & development activities; will be particularly involved with Corporate programming. This is an entry-level position and candidates with one to two years of experience in the nonprofit or cultural organization are encouraged to apply.

**Application Instructions:**

No phone calls. Please submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample to jobs@koreasociety.org with “Corporate Program Associate: Your Name” in the subject line. We will only accept applications emailed to jobs@koreasociety.org.

**Principal Responsibilities:**

***Corporate Programs***

*Programming*

* Manage in the development, coordination, and implementation of Corporate Programs and events such as the Leadership Series, program-funded series, etc.
* Identify speakers and conduct press and audience outreach
* Coordinate and execute program administrative logistics
* Research potential speakers and partner with other organizations to organize regular programs
* Coordinate on-site program management including reception and registration, event A/V tasks, setup, and breakdown
* Assist live webcast and video release programs by managing audience questions and managing the editing process with the Media Team
* Collect promotional and marketing materials for Corporate programs and events
* Respond to external inquiries and requests related to Corporate programs and events

* Ability to work independently and take initiative, as well as collaborate as part of a team
* Ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks, prioritize and meet tight deadlines
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Ability to work effectively in a team and independently
* Attention to detail and project management skills
* Interest in and knowledge of U.S.-Korea relations

* Position requires occasional nights and weekends for events

No phone calls. Please submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample to jobs@koreasociety.org with “CorporateProgram Associate: Your Name” in the subject line. We will only accept applications emailed to jobs@koreasociety.org.

description:
At **HouseCalls Home Care**, our mission is to provide superior, compassionate home care workers and healthcare services for elderly and differently abled individuals in the comfort and dignity of their homes. We work closely with hospitals, physicians, and private caregivers for hire to develop and coordinate individual care plans, all while upholding our clients' independence at home.

As a Service Coordinator, you will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth delivery of home care services to our clients. title: Human Resources Director
description:
**Overview:**

Kingsbridge Heights Community Center (KHCC) is a 49 year old multi-service not-for-profit organization based on the settlement house model and located in the Bronx. We provide resources for Bronx residents from cradle to career to advance education and well-being for a vibrant community. KHCC serves over 6,500 families annually with an inclusive environment for children with special needs, low-income families, recent immigrants, survivors of sexual and domestic abuse, and at-risk teens. KHCC helps participants overcome adversity and develop the skills they need to build bright futures.

**Job Summary:**

Reporting to the CEO, the Human Resources Director will ensure that all human resources (HR) operations are carried on smoothly and effectively including but not limited to employee & union relations, organizational professional development, compliance & human resources best practices. You will be responsible for developing HR strategies and providing sound advice to senior management on all related subjects and coaching the HR team on HR disciplines.

**Essential Responsibilities Overview**

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

● Acts as coach and mentor to all employees in the HR department.

● Provides constructive and timely performance evaluations to HR Staff

● Handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy & collective bargaining agreement.

**Employee & Union Relations:**

● Resolve workplace conflicts when issues arise among employees or between employees and managers to promote a healthy work environment.

● Provide advice and guidance to management as needed during labor relations contract negotiations, including drafting proposals and facilitating meetings with union representatives

● Oversee collective bargaining procedures, including mitigating grievances (managing when they do arise), leading Parent Policy presentations and ensuring full agency compliance.

● Communicate effectively with managers, executives and union representatives daily to create positive working environment, address worker grievances and verify compliance with contractual protocols

● Assist program during contract and funding audits, inspections and engagement. Troubleshoot and resolve issues quickly and permanently

● Act as trusted advisor to directors, managers and supervisors to ensure that all staff are embodying the mission and values of KHCC.

**Compliance:**

● Oversee all compliance efforts in the HR Department which includes but is not limited to Annual reporting (EEO-1, OSHA, Benefits, COBRA, etc.), internal HR audits, federal audits and fiscal audits.

● Oversee all activities relating to the administration and maintenance of payroll and employee benefits programs.

● Maintain and expand knowledge and understanding of existing and proposed federal and state laws/regulations affecting human resource management. Identify trends that could affect organizational objectives and/or operational resources. Interpret appropriate laws and policies and advise management, employees and retirees accordingly. Ensure staff, supervisors and agencies comply with protections for employees including Paid Family Leave, FMLA and other.

● Oversee the daily administration of other HR services as directed or assigned, including recruitment and selection, promotions, transfers, contract negotiation and administration, affirmative action/EEO compliance, job classification, performance evaluation, and employee relations in accordance with quality management principles and overall objectives of the organization.

● Work in conjunction with the CEO to review and update the Employee Handbook annually and present it to the Board of Directors for approval. Ensure that all updates, revisions and addendums are processed in a timely manner.

● Report out on a monthly basis all employees that are on a leave of absence to CEO/Fiscal to ensure that all reimbursements are tracked and received in a timely manner.

**Professional Development:**

● Design and implement professional development programs throughout the agency in conjunction with the Human Resources Generalist.

● Oversee compliance on performance reviews and ensure learnings with the Leadership Team.

**Qualifications:**

● Bachelor's degree in Organizational Leadership, Business Administration, Human Resources, SHRM-CP Certification or related field/ equivalent experience

● 5-7 years of professional experience in human resources Results-driven, action-oriented working style with attention to detail and experience reporting data

● Bilingual in Spanish and English strongly preferred

● Proven ability to prioritize tasks and manage time well in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

● Ability to work well with a variety of people in supervisory role

● Excellent relationship building skills

● Experience with standard software tools (MS Office, Excel, PowerPoint)

● Excellent written and verbal communication skills

● Passion aligning with KHCC’s mission and values

**Physical Demands:**

● While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; handle, or feel; talk, hear, smell or taste. On rare occasions it may be necessary to move quickly, run, etc. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.

**Schedule:** 35 hours /week, M-F,

**Hybrid working schedule (3 days in the office)**

**Benefits:**

● Vacation

● Medical

● Dental

● Vision

● Paid Safe and Sick Leave

● NYS Disability

● NYS Paid Family Leave

● Birthday Time Off

● 403(b) Retirement Plan

● FSA, DCA, Transit and Parking

● Employer Paid Life Insurance

**Equal Employment opportunity Employer:**

● Kingsbridge Heights Community Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated on the basis of the individual’s actual or perceived disability, protected veteran status, race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, or any other perceived status protected by law.

title: Part-time/Per Diem Bariatric Surgery Nurse Practitioner (NP)
description:

At Doral Health & Wellness, we take pride in being a multi-specialty facility with five state-of-the-art locations. Our top priority is to provide exceptional care to our patients, and it serves as the foundation of our work. We are committed to delivering integrated, high-level, and high-quality healthcare services that align with our mission and values.

Our unwavering dedication to patient satisfaction is reflected in our online reviews, which demonstrate the positive experiences shared by those we serve. We understand the importance of ensuring that every patient receives the best possible care, and we strive to exceed their expectations.

title: Nephrology / Dialysis Social Worker (SW)
description:
Doral Dialysis Center is seeking a **Nephrology Social Worker** to join our team.

**Main Functions:**  
Nephrology social work services support and maximize psychosocial functioning and adjustment of patients who are experiencing end-stage renal disease (ESRD) and their families.

These services are provided to ameliorate social and emotional stresses resulting from the interacting physical, social, and psychological concomitants of ESRD, including shortened life expectancy; altered lifestyle with changes in social, financial, vocational, and sexual functioning; and the demands of a rigorous, time-consuming, and complex treatment regimen.

Social work functions are a part of the interdisciplinary team (IDT) and are responsible for fostering a positive treatment environment policy and routines that are attuned to cultural, religious, and ethnic differences among patients and families and show respect for the individuality, independence, and choice of each patient.

**Essential Job Functions:**  
1. Conduct initial patient psychosocial assessment and comprehensive plan of care as well as prepare appropriate documentation for review by the interdisciplinary team.  
2. Provide support, information, and assistance in treatment planning.  
3. Develop and continue to monitor psychosocial goals for plan of care.  
4. Counsel new patients and families on pre-dialysis education, including treatment options (e.g. transplantation).  
5. Act as an advocate on behalf of the patient and family.  
6. Complete and document initial and ongoing comprehensive assessments, evaluations and quarterly notes, along with documenting and monitoring ongoing psychosocial issues and patient goals and readjust when goals are not met.  
7. Notify the interdisciplinary team of patient psychosocial issues affecting treatment.  
8. Facilitate and/or refer patients and families to support/education groups, whenever possible.  
9. Facilitate education on Advance Directives and treatment modalities.  
10. Coordinate and participate in patient/family care conferences with interdisciplinary team.  
11. Analyze and provide information and facilitate referrals to community, private, state and federal agencies based on psychosocial need (e.g. financial programs, medication assistance programs, Vocational Rehabilitation Programs, transportation resources, mental health and chemical dependency resources and home health/homemaking agencies.)  
12. Provide crisis intervention expertise as necessary.  
13. Provide assistance to patient and family in adjusting to dialysis and altered life-style, and provide resource information.  
14. Arranges patient travel arrangements for both guest and permanent patients and ensure completion of arrangements.  
15. Coordinates patient transfers/ visit to other facilities.  
16. Assistance regarding health insurance:

* Assist patients with financial concerns for National Kidney Foundation, American Kidney Fund, state renal programs, Veterans Administration, etc.
* Support patient questions regarding Medicare and Medicaid.
* Coordinate patient Medicare and/or Medicaid assistance entitlements and all appropriate documents.
* Assist patients in answering billing questions.
* To help answer commercial insurance questions for patients.
* To provide facility education on commercial insurance economics.

17. Comply with policy and procedures and in accordance with state and federal regulations for patient care and services. (Medicare, OSHA, OIG, or other governing agencies)  
18. Maintain patient confidentiality.  
19. Participate in QAPI teams, facility team meetings, and in-services.  
20. Administer patient quality care in a considerate, respectful manner.  
21. Communicate with ESRD Network  
22. Complete and submit all ESRD Network reporting requirements. (CROWNWEB, QIPS)  
23. Distribute and collection of patient satisfaction survey and KDQOL data input and analyzing data.  
24. Coordinate and arrange for annual CAHPS survey.

**Standards of Caring Behavior:**  
1. On all occasions, to approach the patients, families and all visitors in a courteous, friendly manner with respect to their rights and concerns.  
2. To reduce patients, families and visitors anxieties by introducing self, explaining all procedures and possible delays in schedule, orienting them to the facility, and maintaining a neat, professional appearance.  
3. To converse with patients and their families to ascertain any specific problems that need attention and refers them to appropriate sources when indicated: i.e. Physician, Administrator, Nurse, Dietitian and Social Worker.  
4. To maintain the confidentiality and privacy of all patients by providing an area for confidential conversation and screening when necessary.  
5. In general, demonstrates Caring Behaviors through making eye contact, smiling, initiating conversation and sharing a genuine concern for the situation.

**Physical, Emotional and Sensory Requirements:**  
1. Must be able to cope with mental and emotional stress of the position.  
2. Must function independently, have flexibility, personal integrity and the ability to work effectively with the patients, staff, family members, visitors and support regulatory agencies.  
3. Must be in good general health and demonstrate emotional stability.  
4. Must demonstrate a caring attitude and be able to relate to and work with the ill, disabled, elderly, emotionally upset, and at time hostile people within the facility.  
5. Must adhere to dress code and maintain a high level of personal hygiene and cleanliness.  
6. Ability to read, write, understand and speak English and basic math skills in a clear and concise manner.  
7. Must have communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with a wide variety of individuals

**Job Qualifications:**

* Hold a master's degree in social work with a specialization in clinical practice from a school of social work accredited by the Council on Social Work Education; or
* Have 2 years of social work experience, 1 year of which in a dialysis or transplant program prior to 9/1/1976, and a consultative relationship with a social worker meeting the above requirements
* State license in Clinical Social Work
* Strong interviewing skills for patient evaluation, problem-solving, and recording
* Possess strong analytical skills to assist patients in problem-solving and resolution
* Capable of communicating clearly and effectively with all types of physically and mentally challenged patients and their families
* Professional, flexible, and a team player

**Compensation**

* Salary - $40 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Dental Insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

* Vision insurance

title: Sales Representative
description:
About Us:  
At Medical Essential Diagnostics, we are committed to improving the health and well-being of our communities by providing essential cardiopulmonary diagnostic screenings to first responders, educators, and state employees across New Jersey. We are expanding our outreach and are looking for a motivated Client Acquisition Representative to join our team.

Role Overview:  
As a Sales Representative in our Government Outreach team, you will play a crucial role in building relationships with key NJ state departments, including Police, Fire, Municipal, Public Works, and more. Your primary responsibility will be to make outbound calls to schedule information sessions, where our field marketers can present our life-saving programs and secure preregistrations. This is not just a sales job; it’s an opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of those who serve our community.

Key Responsibilities:  
- Conduct cold calls to various NJ state departments, including Police, Fire, Municipal, and Public Works, to set up informational sessions.  
- Build and maintain relationships with key contacts within these departments.- Participate in weekly meetings to discuss performance, progress, goals, and strategy.  
- Collaborate with field marketers to ensure successful execution of information sessions.  
- Track and report on outreach efforts and session scheduling.  
- Consistently meet and exceed outreach and scheduling goals.

Why Join Us?  
- Guaranteed Hourly Pay + Uncapped Bonus Structure: Your hard work will directly impact your earnings, with no limit to what you can achieve.  
- Advance at Your Own Pace: We believe in recognizing and supporting top performers. Your growth and advancement are directly tied to your success—excel and you’ll be rewarded.  
- Team Success Rewards: Our "High Five Program" offers a lucrative incentive structure that celebrates both individual achievements and team-based success.  
- Paid Time Off & Sick Time: We value work-life balance and offer generous PTO and sick time.  
- Open and Collaborative Work Environment: Join a team that values collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.  
- Career Growth Opportunities: As we continue to grow, so will your opportunities for advancement.

What We’re Looking For:  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.  
- Ability to handle rejection and remain positive.  
- Previous experience in sales, particularly cold calling, is a plus but not required.  
- Passion for making a difference in the community.

How to Apply:  
If you’re excited about the opportunity to be part of a mission-driven organization and want to thrive in a dynamic sales role, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team and help us make a difference in the lives of New Jersey’s first responders, educators, and state employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience:

* Cold calling: 1 year (Required)
* Email marketing: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Princeton, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sanitation Manager
description:
ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.

  

**OVERVIEW**

  

The Sanitation Manager directs and coordinates the execution of activities related to the cleaning and sanitizing of the facility and on-site equipment at the Refinery. Conducts all aspects of job duties in a safe and responsible manner. Partners with other department Managers to establish a defined cleaning frequency, training, work instructions, and through verification activities ensures the effectiveness of the facility sanitation program.

 **DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Coordinates and executes the cleaning of equipment and work areas.
* Manages both cleaning contractors and cleaning employees at the facility
* Inspects premises for unsanitary practices and conditions. Compiles required reports regarding regular inspections, sanitation violations, and steps taken to resolve deficiencies.
* Manages sanitation preventive maintenance program
* Reviews and oversees the Plant Sanitation Program, including working with Cleaning and Sanitation Chemical supplier(s) to determine best cleaning and sanitizing agents and methods for maintaining Company and Regulatory cleaning and sanitizing standards.
* Completes associated documentation in a complete, accurate and timely manner.
* Conducts investigations and root cause analysis on any customer complaints and quality issues pertaining to potential sanitation issues.
* Confers with management, Quality Assurance, Safety and production personnel on sanitation problems, and recommends changes in equipment, plant layout, lighting, ventilation, or work practices to improve sanitation standards and purity of product.
* Ensures GMP's are always met
* Other job duties as assigned.

 **REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

  

* Ability to work well under pressure and in a fast-paced environment.
* Able to be trusted with high sensitive and confidential information.
* Strong interpersonal skills - ability to work independently and as a member of various teams and committees
* Proficient on Microsoft Office applications and software programs used in the workplace
* Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels.
* Two to four years related experience or equivalent in manufacturing environment (food industry preferred)
* Five or more years of proven accomplishments in the supervision of employees, including training, coaching, and team building

 **REQUIRED EDUCATION**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline from an accredited college/university is required or equivalent experience

 **MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY**

  

* Responsible for training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems
* Coordinates Company Cleaning Schedule activities
* Full participation during food safety audits
* Ensures activities complies with all claims and site food safety programs such as Gluten Free and Kosher claims as well as Organic and Allergen programs.
* Ensure Labor Contract is followed by all employees, and reports any potential violation.
* Initiate disciplinary measures according to the Labor Contract.
* Review hourly employees’ performance and identify training needs
* Review and improve employee utilization
* Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions
* Demonstrated proficiency in supervising and motivating subordinates
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner.
* Displays willingness to make decisions and exhibits sound and accurate judgment.
* Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events and reacts well under pressure.
* Follows policies and procedures and uses equipment and materials properly.
* Observes safety and security procedures and report potentially unsafe conditions.
* Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and completes work in a timely manner.

 **LOCATION OF ROLE**

* Yonker, NY Refinery


The pay range for this position is below. The pay rate for the successful candidate will depend on the candidate's qualifications and prior experience.

* Range: $102,500 to $190,500

  

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Education Coordinator - Westfield
description:
**Full-Time Education Coordinator**


Hourly Pay Range: $22.60 - $25.00

**About C2 Education**


At C2 Education, we believe in our students and their potential for greatness. We work hard every day to help students achieve their academic goals so they may attend the college of their dreams. We assist with multiple educational needs such as; College Test Prep, AP Exam, College Essay, and College Admissions. In addition, we offer tutoring for K-12 and AP/Summer Boot Camps.

**Why Join our Team**


As an employee of C2 Education you will be living out our mission, vision, and values. This provides you with a chance to enhance not only your life but the lives of the students you work with.


Pay ranges from $22.60 - $25.00 per hour depending on multiple factors, including specific location, individuals knowledge, skills, and experience.


In addition to the competitive pay, this role offers full-time benefits, including:

* Competitive medical, vision, and dental plans. All benefits are subject to applicable plan documents and policies.
* 401(k) plus a dollar for dollar match up to 4% contribution after six months of employment.
* Flexible Time Off (FTO). You are eligible for FTO upon your first day of employment.
* Free Short-term disability, Long-term disability, Basic Life and AD&D coverage.
* Employee discounts through PerkSpot.
* Employer referral program.
* Discounted tutoring hours.

**Responsibilities**


The Education Coordinator is often the first point of contact between C2 Education and prospects. The role is vital for students and the success of the center. You will assist families of interest take the initial step to join C2 Education.

* Provide a welcoming environment for parents and students.
* Schedule students, testing, and book conferences.
* Ensure delivery of C2 Education programs and initiatives in alignment with our mission statement.
* Call prospective families that have expressed interest in C2 Education services and arrange for a diagnostic test/conference.
* Provide administrative support including answering phones and creating/managing schedules with students and teachers.
* Manage class schedules to effectively support staff sessions.
* Provide marketing support.
* Participate in school and community events as a C2 Education representative.
* Review and grade student tests and monitor all students academic progress.
* Conduct conferences with parents and students to review progress, adjust academic plans, and renew enrollments.

**Schedule**

* Sessions are conducted after school hours to accommodate students and are typically Monday Thursday 1:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturdays 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Each location may vary.

**Required Qualifications**

* Experience working in a team environment.
* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Ability to multitask.
* Sales Experience.
* Authorized to work in the US.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelors Degree (B.A./B.S.).


The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the priorities, skills and abilities required to do the job.C2 Education provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military or veterans status, genetics or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition to federal law requirements, C2 Education complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has operations. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Travel Registered Nurse, Cath Lab
description:
Job Title: Cath Lab, Registered Nurse (RN)

Location: Morristown, NJ

Blended Rate: $2900/wk

Shift: 3x12s - 36hrs - Days - 7a-5p

**Job Description:**

We are currently seeking a skilled and dedicated Cath Lab Registered Nurse (RN) to join our healthcare team in Morristown, NJ. As a Cath Lab RN, you will play a critical role in providing high-quality care to patients undergoing cardiac catheterization procedures. This is a full-time position with an attractive salary of $3420 weekly.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the medical team, including cardiologists and interventional radiologists, to perform diagnostic and interventional cardiac procedures in the Cath Lab.
* Assist in the preparation and setting up of the Cath Lab for procedures, ensuring all necessary supplies and equipment are available and functioning properly.
* Prepare patients for procedures by obtaining vital signs, conducting patient assessments, and explaining the procedure and potential risks in a clear and compassionate manner.
* Monitor patients during procedures, including heart rhythm and vital signs, intervening promptly when necessary to ensure patient safety and comfort.
* Administer medications, as prescribed by the cardiologist or physician, and accurately document all medications given during procedures.
* Assess and document patient responses to procedures, making appropriate nursing interventions, and escalate any concerns or changes in condition to the medical team.
* Collaborate with the healthcare team to develop and implement individualized care plans for patients undergoing cardiac catheterization procedures.
* Educate patients and their families about post-procedure care and provide instructions for follow-up appointments and medications.
* Adhere to all applicable policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure compliance with regulatory standards and promote a safe working environment.
* Participate in ongoing professional development opportunities to enhance knowledge and skills in the Cath Lab setting.
* Maintain patient confidentiality and demonstrate sensitivity to patients' cultural, spiritual, and psychosocial needs.

**Requirements:**

* Valid and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New Jersey.
* Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience in cardiac catheterization, interventional cardiology, or a related field. Cath Lab experience preferred.
* Strong knowledge of cardiac anatomy, physiology, and pathophysiology, as well as familiarity with various cardiac procedures and equipment.
* BLS (Basic Life Support) and ACLS (Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support) certifications.
* Excellent assessment skills, critical thinking abilities, and the ability to respond calmly and efficiently in high-pressure situations.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with patients, families, and healthcare providers.
* Attention to detail and the ability to accurately document patient information and procedures.
* Proficiency in using electronic medical record systems and other relevant healthcare technologies.

If you are a dedicated and compassionate RN with a passion for cardiac care, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and make a difference in the lives of patients undergoing cardiac catheterization procedures.

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Cath Lab, RN jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $2,900.00 per week

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program

Medical Specialty:

* Cath Lab

Physical Setting:

* Acute care

* Cath lab: 2 years (Preferred)

* ACLS Certification (Preferred)

description:

This position also assists in the budget development process and performs budget analysis duties as assigned.**
