title: Project Connect Coordinator
description:
**We are currently looking for a Project Connect Coordinator in our Family Support Services Department. This is a part-time role, days of the week flexible, 20 hours/week.**


**SUMMARY**


Under general supervision of a director, is responsible for helping families and others in understanding how to access services and support for individuals with developmental disabilities for Project Connect and housing Assistance Services programs. Creates and updates flyers promoting agency programs and services. Help to resolve personal, financial, and environmental difficulties that add to the challenges of providing care for a family member with developmental disabilities. Enables and empowers families to advocate appropriately. Works in accordance with ADAPT Community Network (ADAPT) policies, rules and requirements of applicable regulatory agencies and the profession's standards.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


The duties and responsibilities of the Project Connect Coordinator will include, but are not limited to the following:


* Answers the ADAPT Project Connect phone line to assist callers in accessing ADAPT services and support as well as other generic and government related services and supports.
* Tracks pertinent information, i.e. client demographics, disability characteristics and needs from all callers in Project Connect Database.
* Manages caseload for Housing Assistance Services program.
* Places and receives calls to address housing related issues for families with a developmentally disabled family member living in New York City area.
* Documents all phone and email communication, contacts, and advocacy efforts for each case file.
* Monitors status and makes appropriate recommendations and referrals for callers.
* Develops collaborative relationships within the community.
* Provides families and others with resources to be able to meet their needs.
* Provides interactive presentations for families and professionals and attends Developmental Disabilities Council meetings.
* Assures confidentiality of information about services.
* Keeps abreast of changes in field.
* Represents ADAPT at forums and meetings citywide.
* Performs other related duties as requested.

**QUALIFICATIONS**


*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*


* Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.
* Good organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines.
* Good interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with coworkers, employees, children and their families, and outside contacts.
* Proficiency in the use of a computer and knowledge of appropriate software.
* Due to sensitive nature of the position, must be able to maintain the strictest confidentiality.
* Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks.
* Ability to analyze problems and determine corrective measures.


**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE**


* Bachelor's Degree
* At least one year of related work experience in the field of developmental disabilities


**COMPENSATION:** $27.81/hour, 20 hours/week, days flexible


ADAPT Community Network is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified candidates of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and status are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels.
company_description: Mission: Empowering people, through innovative solutions, one person at a time.

title: Office Administrator
description:
**Polar Plumbing, Heating & Air Conditioning** in **Newburgh, NY** is looking to hire a **full-time Office Administrator** to assist with our administrative tasks and provide great customer service. Are you looking to work with a **great team of hardworking people**? Do you want to join an HVAC company that is **close-knit and supportive**? Would you like to work in an environment that **encourages you to learn and helps you succeed**? If so, please read on!


This administrative position earns a **competitive wage** of **$18 - $22/hour**, depending on qualifications and experience. We also provide **excellent benefits**, including **medical, dental, vision, a 401(k), paid time off (PTO), reimbursements, great training, notary help, commissions, bonuses, access to a financial advisor, an amazing team, uniforms, and a positive environment**. If this sounds like the right administrative and customer service opportunity for you, apply today to join our HVAC team!

 **ABOUT POLAR PLUMBING, HEATING & AIR CONDITIONING**


We are an award-winning, BBB-accredited company that provides first-class plumbing, heating, and air conditioning services. We offer completely transparent pricing for all our services, so our customers can be sure they're getting the absolute best value for their homes. Plumbing, heating, and cooling are some of the most important aspects of keeping a home comfortable, and we know that timing makes all the difference. That's why we are quick to respond to our customers' needs and why we offer free estimates. As a result, our customers value our honesty and trust that their homes are in the best hands.


Our employees are our most valuable asset in maintaining our customers' trust. Through **regular development programs**, we ensure that all our employees have the **training they need to succeed**. We also promote an **authentic team mentality** and strive to make our employees feel at home in our **great company culture,** an environment that is **more like family than work**.

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN OFFICE ADMINISTRATOR**


As an Office Administrator, you make sure that all of our administrative operations flow smoothly. As an employee-focused company, we want our clients to have the best HVAC experience with us, so you provide office help for them. You warmly greet and communicate with customers, both in the shop and on the phone. You're always kind and quick to answer questions and find solutions to their concerns. As needed, you also interact with vendors and build great relationships with them. You help with permits, accounting, and rebates. **You get a great sense of accomplishment using your customer service and administrative skills to help others!**

 **QUALIFICATIONS FOR AN OFFICE ADMINISTRATOR**

* Strong work ethic and motivation


Are you task-orientated and self-motivated? Can you be flexible and adapt to changes? Do you have excellent communication skills? Are you organized and detail-oriented? Can you work effectively as part of a team? Do you listen and follow instructions well? Are you someone who can provide great customer service to each of our clients? If yes, you might just be perfect for this administrative position!

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR HVAC TEAM?**


If you feel that you have the right customer service and administrative skills for this job, please fill out our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**. We look forward to meeting you!


Location: 12550

title: Janitor - Commercial Cleaner
description:
**Paramount Services Group Inc.**, **headquartered in** **Brooklyn, NY** is looking to hire a **Janitor - Commercial Cleaner** to work once a week on Saturdays to help us clean for our commercial clients in the **Augusta, NJ** **area!** Do you enjoy keeping things organized and clean? Are you looking to work with a **hardworking, fun team of people**? Would you like to join a **company that invests in its employees and maintains a respectful and casual environment**? If so, please read on!


This cleaning position earns a **competitive wage** of up to **$17.85 per hour**, depending on experience and the location of the job. We provide **great perks**, including **on-the-job training, growth opportunities, and a fun, relaxed atmosphere**. If this sounds like the right janitorial opportunity for you, apply today!

 **ABOUT PARAMOUNT SERVICES GROUP INC.**


Headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, Paramount Services Group Inc. offers professional maintenance, pest control, janitorial, and landscaping services. From medical facilities to daycare centers, we keep buildings and grounds in tip-top shape year-round. Our clients appreciate our commitment to delivering excellent results at competitive prices. At Paramount Services Group Inc., we don't just do the job faster-we also do it better!


We're proud to be an inclusive, diverse company with a supportive working environment. We've learned that when every employee is treated with respect, they pull together to become an engaged, harmonious team. That's why we facilitate a **laid-back, collegial atmosphere** and provide our staff with **flexibility and growth opportunities**. If this sounds like a company you want to be a part of, connect with us today!

 **WHAT DO OUR JANITORS AND COMMERCIAL CLEANERS DO?**


As a Janitor - Commercial Cleaner, you perform various cleaning services at commercial locations. This includes vacuuming, cleaning office spaces or common areas, and cleaning restrooms. When cleaning restrooms, you make sure to replace paper products such as hand towels and toilet tissues. You also remove all recyclables and trash by emptying all wastebaskets and replacing liners, including sanitary product containers in women's restrooms. You're careful with all cleaning products, using water to clean surfaces and then chemicals and cleaning products to disinfect surfaces. You enjoy working with an amazing team and seeing the results of your hard work!

 **QUALIFICATIONS FOR A JANITOR - COMMERCIAL CLEANER**

* 2+ years of commercial cleaning experience


Are you a dependable person with a great work ethic? Do you have great attention to detail? Can you manage your time and tasks in an efficient manner? Are you self-motivated and optimistic? If yes, you might just be perfect for this position!

 **WORK SCHEDULE**


This janitorial position works once a week on Saturdays.

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR JANITORIAL TEAM?**


If you feel that you would be right for this janitorial job, please fill out our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**. We look forward to meeting you!


Location: 07822

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
Patient Care Coordinator

Job Summary:  
We are seeking a dedicated Patient Care Coordinator to join our pediatric physical therapy outpatient clinic team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring seamless patient care coordination and administrative support within our setting.

Responsibilities:  
- Schedule patient appointments and manage the front desk operations efficiently.  
- Coordinate with medical staff to ensure timely and accurate patient care delivery.  
- Maintain patient records, including updating medical histories and insurance information.  
- Provide exceptional customer service by addressing patient inquiries and concerns promptly.  
- Assist in billing processes and insurance verification procedures.

Skills:  
- Proficiency in Leaps and Bounds procedures and terminology.  
- Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.  
- Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.  
- Experience in medical administrative support is preferred.

Join our team as a Patient Care Coordinator to contribute to quality patient care delivery and be part of a supportive healthcare environment that values professional growth. Competitive compensation and opportunities for career advancement are available for the right candidate. Apply now to embark on a fulfilling career path in healthcare administration.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Opportunities for advancement

Schedule:

* No weekends

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Staten Island, NY 10309 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Assistant - Phlebotomist - Hematology and Oncology - Optum
description:
**$1,000 Sign on Bonus for External Candidates**

  


**Opportunities with Optum in the Tri-State region**(formerly CareMount Medical, ProHEALTH New York and Riverside Medical Group). Come make a difference in the lives of people who turn to us for care at one of our hundreds of locations across New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Work with state-of-the-art technology and brilliant co-workers who share your passion for helping people feel their best. Join a dynamic health care organization and discover the meaning behind **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  



The Medical Assistant works to assist clinicians in providing health care at clinic locations. A Medical Assistant serves the patient and all members of the health care team by gathering and maintaining the necessary medical information in a cheerful, friendly, personable manner. This role provides quality patient care and helps to establish rapport between the clinician and patient. The Associate Medical Assistant works to assist clinicians in providing health care at clinic locations. A Medical Assistant serves the patient and all members of the health care team by gathering and maintaining the necessary medical information in a cheerful, friendly, personable manner. This role provides quality patient care and helps to establish rapport between the clinician and patient.



The Medical Assistant will increasingly gain responsibility for providing assistance to the healthcare clinician by providing direct patient care.



**Primary Responsibilities:**

  

* Obtains patient histories and vital signs and records accurately in the Electronic Medical Record
* Rooms patients, prepares patients for examination and procedures, assists providers and patients during procedures
* Daily blood draw, preparation of specimen and packing for transportation for all laboratory tests ordered by providers
* Stocks supplies and prepares exam rooms and instruments for examinations, testing, or minor surgeries
* Maintaining/providing clinically safe and clean environment, ensuring all exam rooms are properly wiped down between patients, prepared and stock exam rooms daily with medical supplies and monitoring medical supplies for expiration dates
* Call patients to advise on negative lab results
* Performs other duties as assigned

  



You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Experience in a medical office setting
* Experience with PC and Microsoft office


**Preferred Qualification:**


* Medical Assistant Certification
* 1+ years of experience working as a Medical Assistant performing front and clinical back-office duties
* Experience working with EPIC EMR software
* Excellent customer service skills

  


**New York Residents Only:** The hourly range for this role is $16.00 to $23.94 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.



*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  

*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: Professional Painter - Handyman
description:
Are you ready to embark on a thrilling journey that combines your artistic talent, handyman skills, and love for travel? **Resicom**, the premier general contracting company based in **Woodridge, IL**, is seeking a skilled and adventurous individual like you to join our dynamic team as a **full-time Professional Painter - Handyman**.


Step into a world where your dedication is rewarded with a **competitive annual salary** ranging from **$65,000 to $75,000**, based on experience. But that's not all! Resicom goes above and beyond with **terrific benefits**, including health insurance, a 401(k) with a company match, paid time off (PTO), a great work environment, upward mobility, a fully equipped company van, and cell phone reimbursement. Pack your brushes, get your tools ready, and let's paint the nation together!

 **MORE ABOUT OUR COMPANY**


We are a full-service general contractor offering a complete line of services that includes building construction, renovation, maintenance, repair, and refresh. Our company is built on long-term relationships with our clients and construction partners, as referrals and repeat clients generate more than 80% of our projects. We have successfully completed thousands of commercial construction projects throughout the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Clients count on our "go anywhere, do anything" team because we are well-trained, disciplined, and have a Ph.D. in resilience. People hire us because we get results.


Our team thrives on the thrill of completing important projects with tight deadlines. We accomplish great things together, and we enjoy ourselves while we do it because of our **team-centric culture**. To show our appreciation for our employees, we offer **flexibility** and promote a **healthy work-life balance**. We also encourage **career growth** by offering **opportunities for upward mobility** and chances to **work across departments**. We value our fantastic team and hope you will join us!

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A PROFESSIONAL PAINTER - HANDYMAN**


Imagine waking up in a cozy hotel room with a view of Chicago's bustling city. Today, you embark on an adventure at a retail facility, armed with paintbrushes and tools to transform the space. Greeting clients with a warm smile, you effortlessly explain the scope of work, putting their minds at ease. Throughout the day, you expertly patch holes and cracks, skillfully applying primer and sealers. Mixing paints to perfection, you turn ordinary walls into stunning works of art. Traveling to cities like Miami and Boston, you overcome unique challenges while building lasting client relationships!

 **QUALIFICATIONS FOR OUR PROFESSIONAL PAINTER - HANDYMAN**

* Experience as a professional painter and handyman
* Ability to travel out of state up to 75% of the time
* Willingness to work weekends and overnights when needed
* Availability for up to a 50-hour workweek
* A valid driver's license


Preferred qualifications:

* Familiarity with working on a crew
* Experience working on retail facilities

 **WORK SCHEDULE**


This role requires quite a bit of travel. You'll find yourself traversing the nation, visiting various locations, including Chicago, IL, Hartford, CT, Dallas, TX, Las Vegas, NV, and more! The schedule may include weekends and overnights, but each day promises exciting new opportunities to showcase your skills and explore diverse cities!

 **WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU!**


Are you ready to embark on a rewarding adventure with Resicom? Our 3-minute, mobile-friendly initial application process is quick and easy, ensuring you have more time to focus on what you do best – painting and craftsmanship! Simply complete it to get started! We're excited to meet you!

title: Medical Assistant
description:
We are looking for a Medical Assistant to join our primary care team. The ideal candidate will have experience in the medical field and be able to provide exceptional patient care. The successful candidate will prepare patients for exams, assist physicians, and provide patient education. The successful candidate will be organized, detail-oriented, and able to work well in a fast-paced environment.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Experience with drawing blood from adult, pediatric and infant patients and processes specimens following established procedures and techniques.
* Demonstrates positive customer service skills towards patients, physicians, and coworkers. This includes, but is not limited to, friendliness, courteousness, and patience.
* Maintains all logs and required checks (i.e., refrigerator temperatures, Vaccine distribution, emergency medications, expired medications, oxygen, etc.)
* Responsible for transmitting order information to the labs, logging receipt of results, and distributing lab results to the appropriate medical provider.
* Responsible for restocking, and maintenance of supplies, vaccines, and equipment used in lab room.
* Maintains the lab room between patients, cleaning it and always sanitizing it.
* Pediactric Immunization

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training

Medical Specialty:

* Pediatrics
* Primary Care

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Experience:

* Phlebotomy: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Full-time Front Desk Team Member
description:
**\\*\\*PLEASE DO NOT APPLY TO THIS JOB IF YOU DO NOT LIVE IN/AROUND (I.E., ~20 MINUTES OR LESS FROM) NEW PROVIDENCE, NJ\\*\\***

Murray Hill is a thriving, spacious, state-of-the-art six-court indoor tennis facility in New Providence, NJ. We specialize in adult and junior tennis clinics, tennis leagues, private instruction and cardio tennis. Murray Hill is a professionally run, popular locally-owned business.

We're searching for a front desk team member (20-30 hours per week). The front desk team member should be an energetic people person, who would love interacting with our amazing clients on a day to day basis.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Greet clients and manage check-ins.
* Anticipate and resolve client needs in a timely, professional manner.
* Manage incoming calls, texts and emails.
* Manage new and existing reservations.
* Collaborate with front desk team and with management.

**Qualifications needed:**

* Computer skills required.
* Customer service experience preferred.
* Retail and/or sales experience preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and written/oral communications skills.
* Able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.

**Benefits:**

* Unique, fun and energetic work environment
* Be a part of our highly collaborative, dynamic team!
* Employee discount on tennis and our retail shop, MHlab

**Schedule:**

* 20-30 hours/week.
* Note this is not a Monday-Friday, 9-5pm schedule
* Weekend availability. \\*\\*This position involves working one weekend day\\*\\*
* (As part of your Indeed application to us, please separately send an email to amys@murrayhilltennis.com with the Subject Line: I <3 TENNIS. In the body of the email include one line about why we should consider you for the role.)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $28.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you live in or around New Providence, NJ? (Please do not apply to this job if you live further than 20 minutes from our address.)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)
* Night Shift (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New Providence, NJ 07974: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Walmart Retail Specialist
description:
As a Retail Specialist at Premium, you’ll ensure Premium’s client brands stand out at Walmart stores by driving product availability. Your efforts executing retail merchandising activities will connect customers with the brands they love in one of the largest retailers in the world. **What’s in it for you?*** Flexible schedule, Monday-Friday.
* You’ll merchandise brands you know and love in a variety of categories.
* Variety in your job tasks. You won’t get stuck doing the same thing every day.
* Independence in your day-to-day work.
* Training and certification provided by true retail experts.
* Health plan options including no-copay telemedicine, regardless of hours worked.
**What will you do?*** Locate merchandise in the backroom of Walmart stores in order to place product on the floor.
* Stock and pack out products to help ensure shoppers find what they need.
* Front face products to make sure product shelves look the best they can.
* Receive marketing and promotional materials at your home and bring them to the store.
* Install and place promotional materials as outlined in instructions to ensure our clients’ products stand out.
* Build displays to showcase client products as needed.
* Answer simple, step-by step questions within Premium’s field technology on your mobile device as you complete your work.
* Take photos of completed work to demonstrate your success.
* Represent Premium and Premium clients in your assigned Walmart store(s).
* Partner with Walmart store management and associates to get the job done.
* Collaborate with your direct manager via email, phone and text.
**How will you succeed?*** Owning your store(s). You will be the face of Premium as you visit Walmart on behalf of our clients. Over time, you’ll be the go-to Premium resource because of the relationships you build.
* Enjoy working independently as a Premium representative but remembering you’re an extension of the Walmart family.
* Effectively communicating with store associates, store managers and Premium team members.
* Leveraging the support of and sharing best practices with our Walmart team nationwide through closed social media groups and a variety of communication channels.
* Contacting Premium’s Operations Support Center for help with challenges in store - they’re here to help!
* Completing work within the provided timeframe
* Closely following detailed instructions to ensure we get it right the first time.
* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* Reporting your work the same day you complete it.
**What tools do you need for the job?*** Access to reliable transportation to get you from multiple retail locations in your area.
* A smartphone with access to data and internet in order to report and upload photos.
  

This job posting covers the general job duties for our Retail Specialist position and does not imply that these are the only tasks required. Premium’s Talent Acquisition Team will go over any questions you have regarding the above during the interview process.  



Learn more about our retail specialist position here: https://premiumretail.com/teamwalmart/  

So, are you Premium’s next Retail Specialist?




#WeArePremium
